original: bsam gtan dag la ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la gzugs med pa dag la gzugs kyi rnam pa ma gsungs pa la ni de med pa ma gtogs pa rgyu gzhan rtogs par mi nus te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dag la ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la gzugs med pa dag la gzugs kyi rnam pa ma gsungs pa la ni de med pa ma gtogs pa rgyu gzhan rtogs par mi nus te /
translated: The reason why the aspect of form is not mentioned in the formless realm is that it is impossible to understand any other reason for the absence of form there.

original: de'i phyir gzugs med pa na gzugs med do zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs med pa na gzugs med do zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore it is established that there is no form in the formless realm.

original: da ni ji ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: Now, how is it that beings of the formless realm are said to be embodied?

original: gal te gzugs med pa dag na gzugs med na de dag 'chi 'pho zhing khams 'og mar skye ba'i tshe gzugs rgyun bcad pa rnams kyi gzugs yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gzugs med pa dag na gzugs med na de dag 'chi 'pho zhing khams 'og mar skye ba'i tshe gzugs rgyun bcad pa rnams kyi gzugs yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If form does not exist in the formless realm, then when beings die in the formless realm and are reborn in a lower realm, form would not arise from a severed continuum.

original: dgra bcom pa 'khor ba phung po rgyun chad pa la yang 'byung bar thal lo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa 'khor ba phung po rgyun chad pa la yang 'byung bar thal lo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And it would follow that the continuum of aggregates of an arhat would arise again in cyclic existence.

original: gzugs ni sems las skye ba yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩgzugs med pa dag na gzugs med pa dag tu skye ba rnams la /
analyzed: gzugs ni sems las skye ba yin // zhes bya ba la / gzugs med pa dag na gzugs med pa dag tu skye ba rnams la /
translated: Form arises from mind.

original: gzugs dang mthun pa'i sems kyi rgyun nyid gnas la /
analyzed: gzugs dang mthun pa'i sems kyi rgyun nyid gnas la /
translated: In the formless realm, the continuum of mind that is similar to form remains.

original: de nyid de dag gi 'chi ltas yin no zhes smras te /
analyzed: de nyid de dag gi 'chi ltas yin no zhes smras te /
translated: That itself is the death sign of those beings.

original: de'i phyir sngar gzugs dang lhan cig spyod pa'i sems kyi rgyud kyis rkyen gyis rnam par smin pa'i rgyu sngar 'gags pa las gzugs skye ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar gzugs dang lhan cig spyod pa'i sems kyi rgyud kyis rkyen gyis rnam par smin pa'i rgyu sngar 'gags pa las gzugs skye ste /
translated: Therefore, form arises from the prior cessation of the cause of karmic maturation through the continuum of mind that previously coexisted with form acting as a condition.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni 'das pa dang de ltar byung ba khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni 'das pa dang de ltar byung ba khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is accepted that homogeneous causes are past and present.

original: dgra bcom pa rgyun ma lus par bcad pa la las dang nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir phung po skye ba'i rkyen 'ga' yang med pas yang de 'byung bar thal ba med do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rgyun ma lus par bcad pa la las dang nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir phung po skye ba'i rkyen 'ga' yang med pas yang de 'byung bar thal ba med do //
translated: Because arhats have completely severed the continuum of the aggregates, they have no karma or affliction and therefore there is no condition for the arising of the aggregates.

original: re zhig 'di ni bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'di ni bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs yin no //
translated: This is the system of the Vaibhasikas.

original: mdo sde pa'i tshul gyis ni de'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyus yongs su bsgos pa'i sems 'jug pa rnyed pa las zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mdo sde pa'i tshul gyis ni de'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyus yongs su bsgos pa'i sems 'jug pa rnyed pa las zhes bya ba ste /
translated: According to the Sautrantikas, the sutra means that the mind that is fully matured by the cause of karmic maturation obtains entry.

original: de zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa dag na 'chi 'pho bal skye ba gang yin pa de'i 'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa dag na 'chi 'pho bal skye ba gang yin pa de'i 'o //
translated: The word that refers to the mind that is fully matured by the cause of karmic maturation is that which is born at death and passes away in the formless realm.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni de 'phen par byed pa'i sems pa'o //üîΩdes bsgos pa ni gzugs de bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni de 'phen par byed pa'i sems pa'o // des bsgos pa ni gzugs de bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is the mind that propels that birth.

original: @272a * // de la nus pa gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @272a * // de la nus pa gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is fully matured by that cause because it is imbued with the potential to generate form.

original: de 'jug pa ni rgyud la rnyed pa yin pas sems 'jug pa rnyed pa las te /
analyzed: de 'jug pa ni rgyud la rnyed pa yin pas sems 'jug pa rnyed pa las te /
translated: It obtains entry to the mindstream.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyus yongs su bsgos pa'i sems 'jug pa rnyed pa de las gzugs skye ba'i gzugs las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyus yongs su bsgos pa'i sems 'jug pa rnyed pa de las gzugs skye ba'i gzugs las ni ma yin no //
translated: and the mind that is infused by the cause of its karmic maturation obtains entry, but form does not arise from form.

original: dgra bcom pa la ni de ltar rnam par smin pa'i bag chags 'jug pa rnyed pa'i rgyu sa bon sred pa med pas yang de la skye ba'i rgyun du thal ba med do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la ni de ltar rnam par smin pa'i bag chags 'jug pa rnyed pa'i rgyu sa bon sred pa med pas yang de la skye ba'i rgyun du thal ba med do //
translated: In the case of an arhat, since the seed of craving does not exist as the cause for the entry of the latent imprints of karmic maturation, there is no consequence of a continuum of birth for him.

original: ji ltar gnas pa ni sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /üîΩder ni ris dang srog la yang //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa ni sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni / der ni ris dang srog la yang //
translated: How it abides was previously explained.üîΩThere, the continuum of mind

original: sems kyi rgyud ni brten pa yin //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud ni brten pa yin //
translated: is supported on the class and life force.

original: zhes bya ba dang / gang gi rgyud gzugs la sred pa bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / gang gi rgyud gzugs la sred pa bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin to //
translated: And it was previously explained that the continuum of one who is free from craving for form and so on.

original: gsum po zhes bya ba'i gzugs med pa zhes sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gsum po zhes bya ba'i gzugs med pa zhes sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: The term three is connected to the formless realm.

original: pho'i rtags kyi bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pho'i rtags kyi bstan pa yin no //
translated: The term male is taught.

original: de ltar sbyor phyir zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i dus na nam mkha' la sogs pa la dmigs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar sbyor phyir zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i dus na nam mkha' la sogs pa la dmigs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because it is connected to that, at the time of connection, it focuses on space and so on.

original: gzhan na ni ci rigs par chos gzhan dag la yang dmigs so zhes ston to //
analyzed: gzhan na ni ci rigs par chos gzhan dag la yang dmigs so zhes ston to //
translated: Other objects are observed in other realms as appropriate.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyom du mos pa'i sbyor ba grub pas gzugs la rnam par grol ba'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa la de'i sa pa'i phung po dag la nam mkha'i 'du shes yang dag par gnas so ;
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyom du mos pa'i sbyor ba grub pas gzugs la rnam par grol ba'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa la de'i sa pa'i phung po dag la nam mkha'i 'du shes yang dag par gnas so ;
translated: The yogiÃÑs and yoginis who have perfected the practice of the aspiration to the sphere of infinite space are liberated from the form realm, and thus the perception of space is well-established in the aggregates of that realm.

original: / rnam shes mtha' yas so snyam du mos pa'i sbyor ba grub pas ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched de /
analyzed: / rnam shes mtha' yas so snyam du mos pa'i sbyor ba grub pas ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched de /
translated: The sphere of infinite consciousness is the aspiration to the sphere of infinite consciousness that has been perfected through practice.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug yongs su dag pa la mtshan ma bzung nas rnam par shes pa'o zhes yid la byed /üîΩnye bar rtog mos /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug yongs su dag pa la mtshan ma bzung nas rnam par shes pa'o zhes yid la byed / nye bar rtog mos /
translated: Having apprehended the sign of the complete purification of the six collections of consciousness, one should attend to consciousness.

original: yang dag par shes /
analyzed: yang dag par shes /
translated: One should thoroughly understand.

original: sbyor ba de grub pa'i phyir de las langs pas ci rigs par chos gzhan dag la yang dmigs so //
analyzed: sbyor ba de grub pa'i phyir de las langs pas ci rigs par chos gzhan dag la yang dmigs so //
translated: Having perfected that practice, one should observe other objects as appropriate.

original: ci yang med do snyam du btang snyoms kyi sbyor ba grub pas ci yang med pa'i skye mched lta ba rgya che ba dang / mtha' yas pa las des dben pa'i 'du shes kyi mos pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ci yang med do snyam du btang snyoms kyi sbyor ba grub pas ci yang med pa'i skye mched lta ba rgya che ba dang / mtha' yas pa las des dben pa'i 'du shes kyi mos pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception is called ‚Äúextensive‚Äù because the application of the perception of the absence of that is accomplished by thinking ‚Äúthat is absent.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir sbyor ba'i dbang gis ming btags so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyor ba'i dbang gis ming btags so //
translated: Therefore, the name is given according to the application.

original: 'du shes chung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'du shes chung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the perception is weak.

original: rgyu ba mi gsal ba'i phyir 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched yin te 'du shes med pa lta bur de gnas so //
analyzed: rgyu ba mi gsal ba'i phyir 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched yin te 'du shes med pa lta bur de gnas so //
translated: The sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception is so called because it is like the absence of perception, since the movement of perception is unclear.

original: de ni snyoms par 'jug pa bdun la ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes gsal ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni snyoms par 'jug pa bdun la ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes gsal ba ma yin la /
translated: It is not clear perception like the seven meditative attainments.

original: @272b 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag la ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: @272b 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag la ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not non-perception like the attainment of non-perception and the attainment of cessation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: de la yang de ltar sbyor ba'i phyir de nyid kyi sgo nas mi rung ba ma yin nam zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de la yang de ltar sbyor ba'i phyir de nyid kyi sgo nas mi rung ba ma yin nam zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it also unsuitable to apply that term to them because they are similar to those?üîΩTherefore it says,

original: gal te de la yang 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te de la yang 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you say that they are like that,

original: ci'i phyir de dag gis de la de ltar 'dzin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag gis de la de ltar 'dzin zhes bya ba la /
translated: Why do they apprehend it that way?

original: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa po dag gis so //
analyzed: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa po dag gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúThey‚Äù refers to those who enter meditative attainment.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la ste /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment.

original: 'du shes dang 'du shes med pa la skye ba de dag rgyu cis der 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi blo skye zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'du shes dang 'du shes med pa la skye ba de dag rgyu cis der 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi blo skye zhes bya ba la /
translated: Why do those who are born in that base have the discernment of neither discernment nor nondiscernment?

original: 'du shes chung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de nyid rgyur brjod dgos par 'gyur bas de nyid bshad de /
analyzed: 'du shes chung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de nyid rgyur brjod dgos par 'gyur bas de nyid bshad de /
translated: Because discernment is weak. That is the cause that must be stated, so that is explained.

original: sbyor ba'i dbang gis rnam grangs gzhan du ming btags so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dbang gis rnam grangs gzhan du ming btags so //
translated: It is designated by another term due to the power of application.

original: skye mched rnams lus su dkri ba'i phyir dang / rgyas par dkri ba'i phyir skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched rnams lus su dkri ba'i phyir dang / rgyas par dkri ba'i phyir skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: The sense-spheres are so called because they wrap up the body, and because they wrap up the extensive.

original: ji ltar na bdun ni rnam pa gsum yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bdun ni rnam pa gsum yin zhe na /
translated: How are the seven types of meditative attainment threefold?

original: ro myang ldan dang dag pa dang // zag med ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ro myang ldan dang dag pa dang // zag med ces bya ba smos so //
translated: The S≈´tra says: ‚ÄúThere is a meditative attainment that is enjoyed, a pure meditative attainment, and a uncontaminated meditative attainment.‚Äù

original: zag pa med pa ni med do zhes bya ba ni 'du shes dman pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni med do zhes bya ba ni 'du shes dman pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no uncontaminated meditative attainment in the third absorption because discernment is inferior there.

original: bsam gtan nyon mongs pa gzhan dang ldan yang /
analyzed: bsam gtan nyon mongs pa gzhan dang ldan yang /
translated: Even though the absorptions are associated with other defilements,

original: ci'i phyir ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyon mongs pa can du bshad kyi /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyon mongs pa can du bshad kyi /
translated: why is it that only the meditative attainment that is associated with enjoyment is explained as being defiled?

original: nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not associated with other defilements?

original: bsam gtan rnams ni dmigs pa dang 'brel pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir srid pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag kho na bshad de /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams ni dmigs pa dang 'brel pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir srid pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag kho na bshad de /
translated: The absorptions are explained as being associated with existence alone because they are distinguished by being related to their object-field.

original: nyon mongs pa gzhan ni srid pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dmigs pa dang sems sprel bar mi byed de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan ni srid pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dmigs pa dang sems sprel bar mi byed de /
translated: Other defilements do not relate the object-field to the mind in the same way as existence does.

original: ro myang ba'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir dang / ting nge 'dzin dang 'dra bar dmigs pa la nye bar rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ro myang ba'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir dang / ting nge 'dzin dang 'dra bar dmigs pa la nye bar rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it engages by way of relishing, and because it closely investigates the object of observation as similar to meditative stabilization.

original: 'jig rten pa'i dge ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dge ba ni /
translated: Mundane virtue

original: dag pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir dang / ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir dang / ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is called pure because it is not associated with the stain of affliction and because it is endowed with virtuous qualities such as nonattachment.üîΩThat which relishes

original: ro myong bar byed pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni dag pa ro @273a * //üîΩmyong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ro myong bar byed pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni dag pa ro @273a * // myong bar byed pa'o //
translated: is the relishing of purity.üîΩIt arises from that

original: de las ni langs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dag pa las langs pa yin no //
analyzed: de las ni langs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dag pa las langs pa yin no //
translated: means it arises from purity.üîΩThat by which one relishes

original: gang gis ro myong bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni ro myang ba dang mtshungs pa ldan pa ste de la snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis ro myong bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni ro myang ba dang mtshungs pa ldan pa ste de la snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
translated: is the meditative attainment that is concomitant with relishing.

original: bsam gtan kho na yan lag dang ldan pa yin gyi //
analyzed: bsam gtan kho na yan lag dang ldan pa yin gyi //
translated: Only the absorptions possess branches,

original: gzugs med pa rnams ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: but the formless states do not.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: kha cig na re zhi gnas su ro gcig pa'i phyir te /üîΩgang dag gang na rgyu ba rags pa yin pa de dag ni der yan lag nyid du gzhag na /
analyzed: kha cig na re zhi gnas su ro gcig pa'i phyir te / gang dag gang na rgyu ba rags pa yin pa de dag ni der yan lag nyid du gzhag na /
translated: Some say: Because they are of one taste in calm abiding.

original: gzugs med pa dag na ni nye bar zhi ba lhag pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba de dag thams cad rgyu ba zhan pas de dag la yan lag rnam par gzhag pa mi srid pas ting nge 'dzin shes che ba de dag na ni sems las
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag na ni nye bar zhi ba lhag pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba de dag thams cad rgyu ba zhan pas de dag la yan lag rnam par gzhag pa mi srid pas ting nge 'dzin shes che ba de dag na ni sems las
translated: If those that move coarsely in a realm are posited as branches there, then in the formless realm all minds and mental factors move weakly because they are pacified to a greater degree. Therefore it is impossible to posit branches there.

original: byung ba gzhan 'ga' yang gtso bo ma yin no //
analyzed: byung ba gzhan 'ga' yang gtso bo ma yin no //
translated: Since concentration is predominant there, no other mental factors are primary.

original: gcig la ni yan lag gi sgrar yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gcig la ni yan lag gi sgrar yang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable to call one a branch.

original: de'i phyir gzugs med pa dag tu yan lag rnam par ma gzhag go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs med pa dag tu yan lag rnam par ma gzhag go zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore branches are not posited in the formless realm.

original: gzhan dag na re sa gang dag tu sems las byung ba tshar phyin pa 'gag pa de kho nar yan lag rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sa gang dag tu sems las byung ba tshar phyin pa 'gag pa de kho nar yan lag rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: Others say: Branches are posited in those realms where the complete cessation of all mental factors is stopped.

original: bsam gtan dang por ni sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dag 'gag go //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang por ni sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dag 'gag go //
translated: In the first absorption, both pain and mental dissatisfaction are stopped.

original: gnyis par ni rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dag go //
analyzed: gnyis par ni rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dag go //
translated: In the second, investigation and analysis.

original: gsum par ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: gsum par ni dga' ba'o //
translated: In the third, joy.

original: bzhi par ni bde ba'i dbang po 'gag go //
analyzed: bzhi par ni bde ba'i dbang po 'gag go //
translated: In the fourth, the faculty of pleasure.

original: de yan chad na ni sems las byung ba gang yang tshar phyin par ldog pa med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de yan chad na ni sems las byung ba gang yang tshar phyin par ldog pa med do zhes zer ro //
translated: From the fourth meditation on, no mental factor is completely absent.

original: yan lag ces bya ba'i don ci zhig ce na /üîΩ'dis bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa nas bzhi pa'i bar gsal bar byed pas na yan lag ste /
analyzed: yan lag ces bya ba'i don ci zhig ce na / 'dis bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa nas bzhi pa'i bar gsal bar byed pas na yan lag ste /
translated: What is the meaning of branch?

original: mtshon par byed mngon par byed ces bya ba'i don to //üîΩyang na yan lag gi don ni rjes su mthun pa'i don yin la /
analyzed: mtshon par byed mngon par byed ces bya ba'i don to // yang na yan lag gi don ni rjes su mthun pa'i don yin la /
translated: The first meditation is called meditation because it illuminates the path to liberation, and the other meditations are also called meditations because they are of the same type as the first.üîΩOr else, the first meditation is called meditation because it illuminates the path to liberation, and the other meditations are called meditations because they are of the same type as the first.

original: de dag kyang rang gi sa dang mthun pas na yan lag go //
analyzed: de dag kyang rang gi sa dang mthun pas na yan lag go //
translated: Or else, the meaning of branch is the meaning of conformity, because these are in conformity with their stage.

original: yang na yan lag gi sgra ni mchod sbyin gyi yan lag ltar tshogs dag la 'jug ste /
analyzed: yang na yan lag gi sgra ni mchod sbyin gyi yan lag ltar tshogs dag la 'jug ste /
translated: Or else, the word branch is used here in the sense of collection, like the branches of a sacrifice.

original: 'di dag phan tshun tshogs yin pas yan lag yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag phan tshun tshogs yin pas yan lag yin no //
translated: These are branches because they are collected together.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni yan lag kyang yin la bsam gtan yang yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni yan lag kyang yin la bsam gtan yang yin no //
translated: Concentration is both a branch and a meditation.

original: lhag ma rnams ni yan lag yin no zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa la sogs @273b pa rnams so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni yan lag yin no zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa la sogs @273b pa rnams so //
translated: The remaining factors are branches.

original: yan lag bzhi pa'i dmag yan lag dag las don gzhan du gyur pa med par ji lta bar yan lag lnga pa'i bsam gtan yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: yan lag bzhi pa'i dmag yan lag dag las don gzhan du gyur pa med par ji lta bar yan lag lnga pa'i bsam gtan yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as an army with four divisions is not different from its divisions, so too the five-limbed meditative concentration is not different from its limbs.

original: 'dir tshogs pa la ltos nas bstan pa'i phyir don gzhan du gyur pa med do //
analyzed: 'dir tshogs pa la ltos nas bstan pa'i phyir don gzhan du gyur pa med do //
translated: Here, it is not different from its limbs because it is taught in dependence on the collection of its limbs.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re ting nge 'dzin gtso bor brjod pa'i phyir bshad do //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re ting nge 'dzin gtso bor brjod pa'i phyir bshad do //
translated: Vaibhasikas say: It is explained in that way because meditative concentration is the primary factor.

original: sa de dag ni ting nge 'dzin gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: sa de dag ni ting nge 'dzin gtso bo yin te /
translated: Those levels are meditative concentration because meditative concentration is primary.üîΩA sutra states:

original: mdo las ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po ni bsam gtan bzhi dag la blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mdo las ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po ni bsam gtan bzhi dag la blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The faculty of meditative concentration should be seen in the four absorptions.üîΩThe third absorption has five limbs.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa la yan lag lnga ste zhes bya ba ni de la 'du byed btang snyoms ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa'i dga' ba la gtod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa la yan lag lnga ste zhes bya ba ni de la 'du byed btang snyoms ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa'i dga' ba la gtod pa med pa'o //
translated: The equanimity of formative factors is the absence of the attachment to joy of the second absorption.

original: dran pa ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan mi brjed pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan mi brjed pa ste /
translated: Mindfulness is the cause of equanimity, i.e., the non-forgetting of the sign of equanimity.

original: thag mi ring ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: thag mi ring ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: It is like a rope because it holds the mind.

original: shes bzhin ni rjes su bsrung ba'i tshul gyis so //üîΩbtang snyoms yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes bzhin ni rjes su bsrung ba'i tshul gyis so // btang snyoms yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Caution is like a fence because it protects the mind.

original: btang snyoms kyi yongs su dag pa ni btang snyoms yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi yongs su dag pa ni btang snyoms yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The purity of equanimity is the purity of equanimity.

original: sa 'og ma'i skyon dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa 'og ma'i skyon dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the purity of equanimity because it is free from the faults of the lower stages.

original: skyon ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba la sogs pa brgyad de de dag bshad par bya'o //üîΩdran pa yongs su dag pa de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: skyon ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba la sogs pa brgyad de de dag bshad par bya'o // dran pa yongs su dag pa de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The faults are the eight: initial inquiry, investigation, joy, etc.

original: skyon dang bral ba'i phyir ro //üîΩbsam gtan dang po pa zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: skyon dang bral ba'i phyir ro // bsam gtan dang po pa zhes bya ba la ;
translated: Mindfulness is like that, i.e., it is free from faults.

original: bsam gtan dang po na yod pa ni bsam gtan dang po pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po na yod pa ni bsam gtan dang po pa'o //
translated: The first dhyana is the first dhyana.

original: de nyid kyi phyir smra ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir bsam gtan gnyis pa la nang rab tu dang ba lhag pa dang / gsum pa la btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang bde ba rnams lhag pa dang / bzhi pa la bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba lhag pa dang po dang gnyis pa dag tu dga' ba dang bde ba dag khyad par med pa dang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir smra ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir bsam gtan gnyis pa la nang rab tu dang ba lhag pa dang / gsum pa la btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang bde ba rnams lhag pa dang / bzhi pa la bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba lhag pa dang po dang gnyis pa dag tu dga' ba dang bde ba dag khyad par med pa dang /
translated: In the first and second absorptions joy and pleasure are not distinguished.

original: gsum pa dang bzhi pa dag tu btang snyoms dang dran pa khyad par med pa dang / bzhi kar ting nge 'dzin khyad par med pas te /
analyzed: gsum pa dang bzhi pa dag tu btang snyoms dang dran pa khyad par med pa dang / bzhi kar ting nge 'dzin khyad par med pas te /
translated: In the third and fourth absorptions equanimity and mindfulness are not distinguished and in all four meditative attainments concentration is not distinguished.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: yan lag gang dag bsam gtan dang po na yod pa de dag gnyis pa na yang yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag gang dag bsam gtan dang po na yod pa de dag gnyis pa na yang yod dam zhe na /
translated: Are the branches that exist in the first absorption also present in the second?

original: mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four possibilities.

original: mu dang po ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ste /
analyzed: mu dang po ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ste /
translated: The first possibility is investigation and analysis.

original: bsam gtan dang po kho na na yod pa'i phyir dang / gnyis pa na med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgnyis pa na med @274a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po kho na na yod pa'i phyir dang / gnyis pa na med pa'i phyir ro // gnyis pa na med @274a * //
translated: because it exists only in the first meditation and does not exist in the second.

original: pa'i nang rab tu dang ba'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa kho na na yod pa'i phyir dang / dang po na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i nang rab tu dang ba'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa kho na na yod pa'i phyir dang / dang po na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second is internal clarity, because it exists only in the second meditation and does not exist in the first.

original: gsum pa ni dga' ba dang bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga na yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum pa ni dga' ba dang bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga na yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The third is joy, pleasure, and one-pointedness of mind, because it exists in both.

original: mu bzhi pa ni bshad pa las ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so zhes bya ba ni bshad pa dag las gzhan pa'i chos gang dag yin pa de rnams ni bsam gtan dang po'i yan lag ma yin zhing gnyis pa'i yan lag ma yin no //
analyzed: mu bzhi pa ni bshad pa las ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so zhes bya ba ni bshad pa dag las gzhan pa'i chos gang dag yin pa de rnams ni bsam gtan dang po'i yan lag ma yin zhing gnyis pa'i yan lag ma yin no //
translated: The fourth is those dharmas not included in the explanation, which are neither members of the first meditation nor members of the second.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi yan lag thams cad phan tshun sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni yan lag gang dag bsam gtan dang po na yod pa de dag gsum pa na yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi yan lag thams cad phan tshun sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni yan lag gang dag bsam gtan dang po na yod pa de dag gsum pa na yod dam zhe na /
translated: Thus, all the members of the meditations should be mutually combined. Are those members that exist in the first meditation also present in the third?

original: mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four alternatives.

original: mu dang po ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dag go //
analyzed: mu dang po ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dag go //
translated: The first alternative is investigation, analysis, joy, and pleasure.

original: gnyis pa ni btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang bde ba dag go //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang bde ba dag go //
translated: The second is equanimity, mindfulness, introspection, and pleasure.

original: gsum pa ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: gsum pa ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The third is concentration.

original: mu bzhi pa ni bshad pa las ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: mu bzhi pa ni bshad pa las ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: The fourth is those phenomena not included in the above explanations.

original: yan lag gang dag bsam gtan dang po na yod pa de dag bzhi pa na yang yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag gang dag bsam gtan dang po na yod pa de dag bzhi pa na yang yod dam zhe na /
translated: Are the branches that exist in the first absorption also present in the fourth absorption?

original: mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four alternatives.

original: dang po ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dag go //
analyzed: dang po ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dag go //
translated: The first is investigation, analysis, joy, and pleasure.

original: gnyis pa ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The second is the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, pure equanimity, and pure mindfulness.

original: gsum pa ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: gsum pa ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The third is concentration.

original: bzhi pa ni bshad pa las ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni bshad pa las ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: The fourth is those phenomena not included in the above explanations.

original: yan lag gang dag bsam gtan gnyis pa na yod pa de dag gsum pa na yang yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag gang dag bsam gtan gnyis pa na yod pa de dag gsum pa na yang yod dam zhe na /
translated: Are the members of the second meditation also members of the third meditation?

original: mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four alternatives.

original: mu dang po ni nang rab tu dang ba dang dga' ba dang bde ba dag go //
analyzed: mu dang po ni nang rab tu dang ba dang dga' ba dang bde ba dag go //
translated: The first alternative is the internal clarity, joy, and pleasure.

original: gnyis pa ni btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang bde ba dag go //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang bde ba dag go //
translated: The second alternative is equanimity, mindfulness, awareness, and pleasure.

original: gsum pa ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: gsum pa ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The third alternative is concentration.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so//
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so//
translated: The fourth alternative is the factors not included in the above.

original: yan lag gang dag bsam gtan gnyis pa na yod pa de dag bzhi pa na yang yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag gang dag bsam gtan gnyis pa na yod pa de dag bzhi pa na yang yod dam zhe na /
translated: Are the members of the second meditation also members of the fourth meditation?

original: mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four alternatives.

original: mu dang po ni nang rab tu dang ba dang / dga' ba dang bde ba dag go //
analyzed: mu dang po ni nang rab tu dang ba dang / dga' ba dang bde ba dag go //
translated: The first alternative is the internal clarity, joy, and pleasure.

original: gnyis pa ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / btang snyoms @274b yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / btang snyoms @274b yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The second alternative is the sensation that is neither pleasure nor pain, pure equanimity, and pure mindfulness.

original: gsum pa ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: gsum pa ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The third alternative is concentration.

original: bzhi pa ni bshad pa las ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni bshad pa las ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: The fourth is the factors not mentioned.

original: yan lag gang dag bsam gtan gsum na yod pa de dag bsam gtan bzhi pa na yang yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag gang dag bsam gtan gsum na yod pa de dag bsam gtan bzhi pa na yang yod dam zhe na /
translated: Are the members that exist in the first three meditations also present in the fourth meditation?

original: mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four alternatives.

original: mu dang po ni ting nge 'dzin ma gtogs pa bsam gtan gsum pa'i yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: mu dang po ni ting nge 'dzin ma gtogs pa bsam gtan gsum pa'i yan lag rnams so //
translated: The first alternative is the members of the third meditation, excluding concentration.

original: gnyis pa ni ting nge 'dzin ma gtogs pa bsam gtan bzhi pa'i yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ting nge 'dzin ma gtogs pa bsam gtan bzhi pa'i yan lag rnams so //
translated: The second is the members of the fourth meditation, excluding concentration.

original: gsum pa ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: gsum pa ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The third is concentration.

original: bzhi pa ni bshad pa las ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni bshad pa las ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: The fourth is factors other than those mentioned.

original: bsam gtan gsum char na tshor ba bde ba yod pa'i dbang du byas te /üîΩ'dri ba ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum char na tshor ba bde ba yod pa'i dbang du byas te / 'dri ba ni /
translated: The question is asked with reference to the fact that there is pleasure in the first three meditations.

original: ci'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa na yod pa'i bde ba rdzas gzhan du brjod ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa na yod pa'i bde ba rdzas gzhan du brjod ces bya ba ste /
translated: Why is the pleasure that exists in the third meditation said to be a separate substance?

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa na yod pa ni ma yin snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa na yod pa ni ma yin snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: It is thought that it does not exist in the second meditation.

original: yang ji ltar bsam gtan gsum pa na yod pa'i bde ba rdzas gzhan du brjod ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar bsam gtan gsum pa na yod pa'i bde ba rdzas gzhan du brjod ce na /
translated: Also, how is the pleasure that exists in the third absorption described as a different substance?

original: gsum pa la ni btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang bde ba rnams so zhes smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang bde ba rnams so zhes smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that in the third absorption there is equanimity, mindfulness, introspection, and pleasure.üîΩIn the first, it is the pleasure of pliancy.

original: dang po na shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba yin zhes bya ba ni bde ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dang po na shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba yin zhes bya ba ni bde ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of pleasure:

original: shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba dang / tshor ba bde ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba dang / tshor ba bde ba'o //
translated: the pleasure of pliancy and the feeling of pleasure.

original: de la bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dag tu ni shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba'i yang 'di bshad la /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dag tu ni shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba'i yang 'di bshad la /
translated: In the first and second absorptions, the pleasure of pliancy is explained as a branch,

original: bsam gtan gsum par ni tshor ba bde ba yan lag tu bshad pas de'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa'i bde ba bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i bde ba las rdzas gzhan du brjod do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum par ni tshor ba bde ba yan lag tu bshad pas de'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa'i bde ba bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i bde ba las rdzas gzhan du brjod do //
translated: but in the third absorption, the feeling of pleasure is explained as a branch. Therefore the pleasure of the third absorption is described as a different substance from the pleasure of the first and second absorptions.

original: 'di la ni shin tu sbyangs pa bde ba yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di la ni shin tu sbyangs pa bde ba yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Here it says, ‚ÄúIn this, the pleasure of pliancy is pleasure.‚Äù

original: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni /
translated: The cause of that is stated:

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan gnyis na bde ba'i dbang po dang mi ldan pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan gnyis na bde ba'i dbang po dang mi ldan pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because one does not possess the faculty of pleasure in the two absorptions of meditative attainment.

original: de ni lus kyi'am sems kyi gzhi yin grang na /
analyzed: de ni lus kyi'am sems kyi gzhi yin grang na /
translated: If you say that it is the basis of the body or of the mind,

original: gnyi ga yang de na mi srid do //üîΩlus kyi ni rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa yin na snyoms par zhugs pa la ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa kun du 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang de na mi srid do // lus kyi ni rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa yin na snyoms par zhugs pa la ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa kun du 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: then both are impossible there.

original: kha phyir bltas par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha phyir bltas par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The body is that which arises simultaneously with the five consciousnesses, but the five consciousnesses such as eye consciousness do not occur in one who has entered meditative attainment because they engage external objects.

original: de na sems kyi bde ba yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: de na sems kyi bde ba yang mi rigs so //
translated: Mental pleasure is also illogical there.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dga' ba zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde na yod pa'i @275a * //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro // de na yod pa'i @275a * //
translated: Because it is called joy.

original: sems kyi bde ba gang yin pa de ni dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi bde ba gang yin pa de ni dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The mental pleasure that exists there is called joy.

original: ji ste dga' ba ni tshor ba ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan kho na yin la /
analyzed: ji ste dga' ba ni tshor ba ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan kho na yin la /
translated: If you say that joy is a different phenomenon from feeling,

original: bde ba ni bsam gtan gsum na yod pa'i tshor ba sim pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: bde ba ni bsam gtan gsum na yod pa'i tshor ba sim pa yin no snyam na /
translated: and that pleasure is the feeling of mental satisfaction that exists in the third absorption,üîΩthen that is illogical.

original: de'i phyir dga' ba na yid bde ba yin na zhes bya ba smos te dga' ba ni yid bde ba las logs shig tu nges par mi zin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir dga' ba na yid bde ba yin na zhes bya ba smos te dga' ba ni yid bde ba las logs shig tu nges par mi zin la /
translated: Therefore, if it is mental satisfaction when one is pleased,

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba dag kyang cig car yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba dag kyang cig car yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then pleasure and mental satisfaction do not exist simultaneously,

original: tshor ba'i rdzas gnyis sems gcig la mtshungs par ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba'i rdzas gnyis sems gcig la mtshungs par ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because two substances of feeling do not accompany a single mind.

original: de gnyis rnams grangs kyis zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang yid bde ba gnyis so //
analyzed: de gnyis rnams grangs kyis zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang yid bde ba gnyis so //
translated: Those two are enumerated as five branches,üîΩbecause it is said that there are five branches.

original: yan lag lnga zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang yid bde ba gnyis rnam grangs kyis 'byung na ni bsam gtan yan lag bzhi pa kho nar 'gyur gyi yan lag lnga pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yan lag lnga zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang yid bde ba gnyis rnam grangs kyis 'byung na ni bsam gtan yan lag bzhi pa kho nar 'gyur gyi yan lag lnga pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If pleasure and mental satisfaction are enumerated as two, then the fourth absorption would have only four branches, not five,

original: skad cig re re la bde ba dang yid bde ba gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig re re la bde ba dang yid bde ba gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because either pleasure or mental satisfaction would not exist in every moment.

original: gzhan dag na re sems las byung ba'i bde ba'i dbang po ni med pa kho na ste zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i dbang po ni lus kyi kho na yod kyi sems kyi ni med do //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sems las byung ba'i bde ba'i dbang po ni med pa kho na ste zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i dbang po ni lus kyi kho na yod kyi sems kyi ni med do //
translated: The faculty of mental pleasure exists only in the body, not in the mind.

original: sems kyi tshor ba sim pa ni yid bde ba'i dbang po yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi tshor ba sim pa ni yid bde ba'i dbang po yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Mental feeling that is pleasure is the faculty of mental satisfaction.

original: gal te bde ba'i dbang po sems kyi ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te bde ba'i dbang po sems kyi ma yin na /
translated: If the faculty of pleasure does not exist in the mind,

original: 'o na ji ltar bsam gtan gsum par bde ba yan lag tu rnam par gzhag ce na /

analyzed: zhib pa'i kun nas slong ba'i gnas skabs ni dpyod pa'o //

analyzed: rab tu zhi bar rgyu ba'i gnas skabs ni nang yongs su dang ba'o //

analyzed: rdzas gzhan med na ji ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /

analyzed: sems las byung ba ni sems la yod pa yin te /

analyzed: sems nyid sems las byung ba yin par ni mi rigs so zhes bya ba'o //

original: chos gzhan 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: chos gzhan 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
