original: 'chi 'pho ba'i tshe na zhe bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /üîΩ'chi 'pho ba'i tshe zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i srid pa'i gnas skabs yin la /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba'i tshe na zhe bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / 'chi 'pho ba'i tshe zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i srid pa'i gnas skabs yin la /
translated: At death, a defiled mind arises from a pure mind.üîΩAt death, at the time of death, a defiled mind arises from a pure mind.

original: de yang mnyam par gzhag pa yin pas de skye ba'i bsam gtan dag pa pa srid pa yod do //
analyzed: de yang mnyam par gzhag pa yin pas de skye ba'i bsam gtan dag pa pa srid pa yod do //
translated: This is because at the time of death, the mind is not fixed in equipoise.

original: bsam gtan dag tu skyes pa'i skye bas thob pa'i dge ba mnyam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de yang dag par zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dag tu skyes pa'i skye bas thob pa'i dge ba mnyam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de yang dag par zhes bya'o //
translated: Also, a defiled mind arises from a pure mind that is obtained by birth and is in equipoise, which is generated in the absorptions.

original: de'i mjug thogs su rang dang gong ma dang 'og ma'i sa pa nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems nyon mongs pa can skye ste /
analyzed: de'i mjug thogs su rang dang gong ma dang 'og ma'i sa pa nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems nyon mongs pa can skye ste /
translated: Immediately after that, a defiled mind that links to the same level, a higher level, or a lower level arises.

original: dge ba'i sems kyis 'chi 'pho na 'gar yang nying mtshams sbyor ba la gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩnyon mongs pa can las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i sems kyis 'chi 'pho na 'gar yang nying mtshams sbyor ba la gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro // nyon mongs pa can las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: This is because when one dies with a virtuous mind, there is no obstruction to linking.üîΩFrom a defiled mind, a defiled mind of its level arises.

original: sa 'og ma nyon mongs pa can skye'i /
analyzed: sa 'og ma nyon mongs pa can skye'i /
translated: From a defiled mind, a defiled mind of its level arises.

original: sa gong ma pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sa gong ma pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not of a higher level,

original: rang gi sa las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi sa las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is not free from attachment to one's own level.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo ni rnam pa gsum yin te /üîΩkhyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo ni rnam pa gsum yin te / khyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The summit of existence has three types.üîΩThe summit of existence has three types of homogeneous character:

original: srid pa'i rtse mo na ni mthong ba'i lam dang mthun pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ma gtogs pa /üîΩzag pa med pa dang mthun pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa yod kyi /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo na ni mthong ba'i lam dang mthun pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ma gtogs pa / zag pa med pa dang mthun pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa yod kyi /
translated: the summit of existence has the homogeneous character of the factors conducive to penetrative insight that are compatible with the path of seeing,üîΩbut it does not have the homogeneous character of the factors conducive to penetrative insight that are compatible with the uncontaminated path.

original: khyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not have the homogeneous character of the factors conducive to penetrative insight that are compatible with the uncontaminated path,

original: gong nas gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gong nas gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is nothing higher than it.

original: nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni nyon mongs pa skye ba dang / @282b rjes su mthun pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni nyon mongs pa skye ba dang / @282b rjes su mthun pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The homogeneous character of decline is compatible with the arising of afflictions.

original: de las nyon mongs pa can gdon mi za bar skye ba ni ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de las nyon mongs pa can gdon mi za bar skye ba ni ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not that afflictions definitely arise from it.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the others as appropriate.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mjug thogs su ni gcig ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mjug thogs su ni gcig ste /
translated: Immediately after the factors conducive to penetrative insight, one arises.

original: de gcig pu skye'o zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de gcig pu skye'o zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa kho na'o //
translated: One arises immediately after the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: gzhan dag na re khyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa yang skye'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re khyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa yang skye'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the factors conducive to distinction also arise.

original: zag pa med pa las ldang ba'i tshe dag pa pa gang mngon sum du byed ce na /
analyzed: zag pa med pa las ldang ba'i tshe dag pa pa gang mngon sum du byed ce na /
translated: When one arises from the uncontaminated state, which of the three types of formless states does one manifest?

original: nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa ma gtogs pa rnam pa gsum ka yang ngo //
analyzed: nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa ma gtogs pa rnam pa gsum ka yang ngo //
translated: One manifests all three types, except for the factors conducive to regression.

original: 'brel pa dang zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du'o zhes bya ba ni lugs dang mthun pa'i go rims bzhin dang / lugs dang mi mthun pa'i go rims bzhin du'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa dang zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du'o zhes bya ba ni lugs dang mthun pa'i go rims bzhin dang / lugs dang mi mthun pa'i go rims bzhin du'o //
translated: In order, means in accordance with the forward order and in accordance with the reverse order.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir dang / ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir dang / ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because of the absence of affliction and mastery of concentration.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa ni dgra bcom pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa ni dgra bcom pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absence of affliction, because of being an arhat.

original: ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba ni dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba ni dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mastery of concentration is the unfixed liberation.üîΩSimilarly, the remaining formless states are supported by their own level and the level below it.

original: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams kyang rang gi sa dang sa 'og mar zhes bya ba ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched zag pa dang bcas pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo ma gtogs pa brgyad la brten to //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams kyang rang gi sa dang sa 'og mar zhes bya ba ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched zag pa dang bcas pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo ma gtogs pa brgyad la brten to //
translated: The contaminated base of infinite space is supported by eight levels, excluding the summit of existence.

original: zag pa med pa ni sa dgu la brten to //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni sa dgu la brten to //
translated: The uncontaminated base of infinite space is supported by nine levels.üîΩThe contaminated and uncontaminated base of infinite consciousness are supported by seven and eight levels, respectively.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa ni go rims bzhin du sa bdun dang brgyad la brten pa nas bsam gtan dang po zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa 'dod pa dang / bsam gtan dang po la brten pa'i bar yin no //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa ni go rims bzhin du sa bdun dang brgyad la brten pa nas bsam gtan dang po zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa 'dod pa dang / bsam gtan dang po la brten pa'i bar yin no //
translated: The contaminated and uncontaminated first absorption are supported by the desire realm and the first absorption, respectively.

original: cung zad kyang dgos pa mi byed de zhes bya ba ni cung zad kyang dgos pa mi bsgrub zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cung zad kyang dgos pa mi byed de zhes bya ba ni cung zad kyang dgos pa mi bsgrub zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They do not serve any purpose at all means they do not accomplish any purpose at all.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na dman pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na dman pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because they are inferior.

original: srid rtser 'phags pa'i ci yang med //
analyzed: srid rtser 'phags pa'i ci yang med //
translated: The noble ones abandon the contaminants of the summit of existence by manifesting the base of nothingness.

original: ces bya ba la 'phags pa ni zag pa med pa ste /üîΩsrid pa'i rtse mor zag pa med pa'i ci yang med pa'i skye mched mngon sum du byas shing /
analyzed: ces bya ba la 'phags pa ni zag pa med pa ste / srid pa'i rtse mor zag pa med pa'i ci yang med pa'i skye mched mngon sum du byas shing /
translated: The noble ones are uncontaminated.üîΩThey abandon the contaminants of the summit of existence by manifesting the uncontaminated base of nothingness.

original: mngon sum du gyur pa las de'i zag pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum du gyur pa las de'i zag pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They manifest the base of nothingness and abandon the contaminants of the summit of existence.

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dmigs kyis bsal ba'i don ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dmigs kyis bsal ba'i don ston par byed pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù indicates an exception.

original: @283a * // rang gi med pa'i phyir dang de yang nye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: @283a * // rang gi med pa'i phyir dang de yang nye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it does not exist there and it is close.

original: zag pa med pa'i lam med par dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa med la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lam med par dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa med la /
translated: One cannot obtain the state of an arhat without the uncontaminated path.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i zag pa med pa yang med pas der skyes pas dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa gang yin pa des lam 'og ma mngon sum du byed pa las nyes pa med do //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i zag pa med pa yang med pas der skyes pas dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa gang yin pa des lam 'og ma mngon sum du byed pa las nyes pa med do //
translated: And because the uncontaminated state of the summit of existence does not exist, there is no fault in saying that those who obtain the state of an arhat after being born there manifest the lower path.

original: de la ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi sa pa kho na mngon sum du byed kyi /
analyzed: de la ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi sa pa kho na mngon sum du byed kyi /
translated: They manifest only the base of nothingness of the base of nothingness.

original: gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not manifest other levels.

original: de thag nye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de thag nye ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it is close to it.

original: goms par byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: goms par byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: because it is cultivated.

original: srid pa smos pas ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po gzung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: srid pa smos pas ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po gzung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By mentioning existence, contaminated things are included.üîΩFor a sutra states:

original: mdo las srid pa ni chos gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: mdo las srid pa ni chos gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: What are the things that are existence?

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the contaminated things.

original: sa rnams ni sred pas yongs su bcad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sa rnams ni sred pas yongs su bcad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The levels are fully discriminated by craving.

original: sred pa ni rang gi sa'i dmigs pa la nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sred pa ni rang gi sa'i dmigs pa la nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For craving is fixed on the focal object of its level.

original: de gnyis kyis yongs su gcod de /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis yongs su gcod de /
translated: Those two fully discriminate it.

original: dper na gang la 'dod pa'i sred pa rgyas par 'gyur ba de ni 'dod pa'i khams so zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gang la 'dod pa'i sred pa rgyas par 'gyur ba de ni 'dod pa'i khams so zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the statement, That which is the expansion of craving for the desire realm is the desire realm.

original: dge ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zag pa med pa la yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zag pa med pa la yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not the case that uncontaminated states are fully discriminated by those two, because it would then follow that uncontaminated states would be virtuous.

original: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa ni sred pa yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa ni sred pa yin par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not logical that craving focuses on uncontaminated states.

original: 'dod chags min te spang bya'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dod chags min te spang bya'i phyir //
translated: It is not attachment, because it is to be abandoned.üîΩ

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not attachment, because it is to be abandoned.

original: de don du gnyer ba de ni dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa yin gyi sred pa ni ma yin no //üîΩgzugs med dngos gzhi'i dge rnams kyi //
analyzed: de don du gnyer ba de ni dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa yin gyi sred pa ni ma yin no // gzugs med dngos gzhi'i dge rnams kyi //
translated: The one who seeks that is aspiration for virtuous dharmas, but it is not craving.

original: spyod yul zag bcas 'og ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: spyod yul zag bcas 'og ma yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The domain of the actual basis of the formless is not contaminated lower levels.

original: dngos gzhi zhes smos pa ni nyer bsdogs bsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos gzhi zhes smos pa ni nyer bsdogs bsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: The term ‚Äúactual basis‚Äù is mentioned in order to exclude the access concentrations.

original: nyer bsdogs dag ni sa 'og ma la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyer bsdogs dag ni sa 'og ma la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The access concentrations focus on lower levels.

original: dge ba smos pa ni ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dge ba smos pa ni ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The term ‚Äúvirtuous‚Äù is mentioned in order to exclude that which is concomitant with enjoyment.

original: dge ba dang zag pa med pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang zag pa med pa bsdu'o //
translated: It includes virtuous and uncontaminated states.

original: zag bcas smos pa ni zag pa med pa la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: zag bcas smos pa ni zag pa med pa la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúcontaminated‚Äù is mentioned because it focuses on uncontaminated states.

original: sa 'og ma pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not a contaminated entity of a lower level.

original: sa 'og ma rab tu ma zhi ba yin pa'i @283b phyir dang / de dag shin tu rab tu zhi ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sa 'og ma rab tu ma zhi ba yin pa'i @283b phyir dang / de dag shin tu rab tu zhi ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the lower level is not completely pacified and because those are completely pacified.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam pa thams cad du yang dag par 'das pa zhes bshad kyi /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam pa thams cad du yang dag par 'das pa zhes bshad kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is explained as completely transcending all levels,

original: bsam gtan dag la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dag la ni ma yin te /
translated: but not the absorptions.

original: bsam gtan dag ni dmigs pa las 'da' ba med pas /
analyzed: bsam gtan dag ni dmigs pa las 'da' ba med pas /
translated: Because the absorptions do not transcend their focal object,

original: kun du lta ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du lta ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: they are called all-around views.

original: dmigs pa zag pa med pa ni rang gi sa dang sa gong ma pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi sa 'og ma pa yang yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa zag pa med pa ni rang gi sa dang sa gong ma pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi sa 'og ma pa yang yin no //
translated: Not only do uncontaminated states focus on their own level and higher levels, they also focus on lower levels.

original: de yang chos dang rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa rnam pa gnyis yin pas de'i phyir rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa thams cad ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de yang chos dang rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa rnam pa gnyis yin pas de'i phyir rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa thams cad ces bya ba smos so //
translated: Since they are of two types, compatible with Dharma knowledge and with subsequent knowledge, it is said that they focus on all states compatible with subsequent knowledge.

original: chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa yang ma yin la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa yang ma yin la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are not compatible with Dharma knowledge.

original: rang gi gnyen po la dmigs pa'i phyir rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam kho na de dag gi dmigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi gnyen po la dmigs pa'i phyir rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam kho na de dag gi dmigs pa yin gyi /
translated: Because they focus on their own antidotes, they are objects of the path that is compatible with subsequent knowledge.

original: chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not objects of the path that is compatible with Dharma knowledge.

original: chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa yang 'ga' zhig gnyen po ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa yang 'ga' zhig gnyen po ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn't the path that is compatible with Dharma knowledge an antidote?

original: yin mod kyi thams cad kyi ni ma yin no //üîΩdmigs pa zag pa med pa ni zhes khyad par med par smos pas sa 'og ma'i 'gog pa la yang thal bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir sa 'og ma'i 'gog pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yin mod kyi thams cad kyi ni ma yin no // dmigs pa zag pa med pa ni zhes khyad par med par smos pas sa 'og ma'i 'gog pa la yang thal bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir sa 'og ma'i 'gog pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is, but not for all.üîΩSince it is said that uncontaminated objects are objects of the path that is compatible with Dharma knowledge without making any distinction, it would follow that the path that is compatible with Dharma knowledge would focus on the cessation of lower level.

original: dgag bya'i sgo nas de la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag bya'i sgo nas de la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore he says, It is not the cessation of lower level because it is focused on the object of negation.üîΩSince the actual basis is negated, it is said,

original: dngos gzhi bkag pas nyer bsdogs kyi bar chad med pa'i lam rnams kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: dngos gzhi bkag pas nyer bsdogs kyi bar chad med pa'i lam rnams kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The uninterrupted paths of access concentration focus on the cessation of lower level.

original: nyer bsdogs dag ni bar chad med pa'i lam gang dag yin pa de dag gi dmigs pa ni sa 'og ma yin no //üîΩde la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs kyi bar chad med pa'i lam rnams kyi dmigs pa bsam gtan bzhi pa yin la /
analyzed: nyer bsdogs dag ni bar chad med pa'i lam gang dag yin pa de dag gi dmigs pa ni sa 'og ma yin no // de la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs kyi bar chad med pa'i lam rnams kyi dmigs pa bsam gtan bzhi pa yin la /
translated: The focal object of the uninterrupted paths that are access concentrations to the formless realm is the fourth absorption.üîΩThe focal object of the uninterrupted paths that are access concentrations to infinite space is the fourth absorption.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyer bsdogs kyi bar chad med pa'i lam rnams kyi ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched yin pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyer bsdogs kyi bar chad med pa'i lam rnams kyi ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched yin pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The focal object of the uninterrupted paths that are access concentrations to the summit of existence is the base of nothingness.

original: rnam pa gsum po 'di dag las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po 'di dag las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: From among these three types of focal objects,

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa pa dang zag pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa can dag la zag pa med pa gang zhig srid pa des nyon mongs pa @284a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa pa dang zag pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa can dag la zag pa med pa gang zhig srid pa des nyon mongs pa @284a * //
translated: the uncontaminated state that is possible in the absorptions, formless states and uncontaminated states

original: rnams ci rigs par spong ngo //
analyzed: rnams ci rigs par spong ngo //
translated: eliminates afflictions in any appropriate way.

original: zag pa med pa gang gis she na /
analyzed: zag pa med pa gang gis she na /
translated: By which uncontaminated state?

original: dngos gzhis te /
analyzed: dngos gzhis te /
translated: By the actual basis.

original: nyer bsdogs dag pas kyang zhes dmigs kyis bsal ba 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyer bsdogs dag pas kyang zhes dmigs kyis bsal ba 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The exception is that they are also eliminated by pure access concentrations.

original: dag pa pas kyang mi spang na nyon mongs pa can gyi lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dag pa pas kyang mi spang na nyon mongs pa can gyi lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If even pure meditative attainment does not abandon them, then what need is there to mention afflicted meditative attainment?

original: rang nyid dri ma can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid dri ma can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is itself contaminated.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir 'og ma yang ma yin la zhes bya ba la /üîΩbsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi dag pa pas sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams mi spong ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir 'og ma yang ma yin la zhes bya ba la / bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi dag pa pas sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams mi spong ste /
translated: It is not lower because one is free from attachment to it.

original: de las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Pure meditative attainment of the actual basis of the absorptions and formless states does not abandon affliction of lower level because one is free from attachment to it.

original: 'og ma las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi la mi 'jug go //
analyzed: 'og ma las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi la mi 'jug go //
translated: One who is not free from attachment to lower level does not enter the actual basis of the absorptions.

original: de nyid de'i gnyen po ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rang gi sa na yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la /üîΩde nyid de'i gnyen po yin par ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de nyid de'i gnyen po ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rang gi sa na yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la / de nyid de'i gnyen po yin par ni mi rigs te /
translated: It does not exist on its level because it is not the antidote of that.

original: srog thams cad la nyon mongs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / de'i nyon mongs pa dag gis gcig tu 'ching ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog thams cad la nyon mongs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / de'i nyon mongs pa dag gis gcig tu 'ching ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is illogical that it is the antidote of that because it would follow that all beings would be free of affliction and because they are bound by their affliction.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams de las rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩnyon mongs pa gang zhig dngos po gang la rgyas par 'gyur ba des ni dngos po de gzhom par mi nus te /
analyzed: de'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams de las rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // nyon mongs pa gang zhig dngos po gang la rgyas par 'gyur ba des ni dngos po de gzhom par mi nus te /
translated: Because the defilements of that stage increase in it.

original: dper na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa de nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa de nyid bzhin no //
translated: One cannot conquer a thing by means of that in which a defilement increases in regard to that thing, just as one cannot conquer desire by desire itself.

original: ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir gong ma yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir gong ma yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Nor is it the higher stage, because it is much more distinguished.

original: dman pas khyad par du 'phags pa spong bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: dman pas khyad par du 'phags pa spong bar mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that the inferior should reject the distinguished.

original: de lta ma yin na 'dod pa'i khams kyis kyang bsam gtan dang po spong ba thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'dod pa'i khams kyis kyang bsam gtan dang po spong ba thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that the realm of desire would reject the first meditation.

original: sa 'og ma'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sa 'og ma'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is the counteragent to the lower stage.

original: des sa 'og ma las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur bas nas 'og ma'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: des sa 'og ma las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur bas nas 'og ma'i gnyen po'o //
translated: It is the counteragent to the lower stage because one becomes detached from the lower stage by means of it.

original: gang gis de la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni nyer bsdogs gang gis bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi de dag la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis de la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni nyer bsdogs gang gis bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi de dag la 'jug pa ste /
translated: What is called ‚Äúaccess‚Äù is the access concentration that enters or manifests those actual bases of absorption and formless states.

original: mngon sum du byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon sum du byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term ‚Äúmanifests‚Äù means ‚Äúis actualized.‚Äù

original: ci de dag kyang rnam pa gsum yin la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci de dag kyang rnam pa gsum yin la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Are they also of three types?

original: @284b dag pa dang zag pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: @284b dag pa dang zag pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: They are pure, uncontaminated, and contaminated.üîΩDo they have feelings that are similar to those?

original: de dag la tshor ba yang de dang 'dra bar yod dam zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi dang 'dra bar bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i nyer bsdogs na dga' ba /
analyzed: de dag la tshor ba yang de dang 'dra bar yod dam zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi dang 'dra bar bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i nyer bsdogs na dga' ba /
translated: Do the access concentrations of the first and second absorptions have joy that is similar to the actual basis of the first absorption?

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i nyer bsdogs na bde ba /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i nyer bsdogs na bde ba /
translated: Do the access concentrations of the third absorption have pleasure that is similar to the actual basis of the third absorption?

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i nyer bsdogs na btang snyoms yod dam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i nyer bsdogs na btang snyoms yod dam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Do the access concentrations of the fourth absorption have equanimity that is similar to the actual basis of the fourth absorption?

original: 'bad de drang bar bya ba'i phyir btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bad de drang bar bya ba'i phyir btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: They possess the faculty of equanimity because they are drawn by effort.

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'byung ba'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin gyi 'bad de drang bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'byung ba'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin gyi 'bad de drang bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is associated with equanimity because it is the path that arises without exertion and because it is not associated with enjoyment, since it is not to be induced through effort.

original: sa 'og ma las yid byung ba dang ma bral ba'i phyir yang dga' ba dang bde ba dag med pas btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sa 'og ma las yid byung ba dang ma bral ba'i phyir yang dga' ba dang bde ba dag med pas btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
translated: It is associated with equanimity because it is not associated with joy and pleasure, since it is not free from the dispassion for the lower stage.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin /
translated: It is not associated with enjoyment because it is the path of detachment.

original: ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i lam nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i lam nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable that the path of detachment is associated with enjoyment.

original: sred pa dang bcas pas ni nyon mongs pa spong bar byed nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sred pa dang bcas pas ni nyon mongs pa spong bar byed nus pa ma yin no //
translated: One who is associated with enjoyment is not able to abandon the defilements.

original: dang po 'phags pa'ang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dang po 'phags pa'ang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The first noble ones are also like this.

original: des ni rang gi sa las kyang yid byung ba dang ldan pas sa 'og ma'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir zag pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni rang gi sa las kyang yid byung ba dang ldan pas sa 'og ma'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir zag pa med pa yin no //
translated: They are also uncontaminated because they are associated with dispassion for their own stage and because they are the antidote to the lower stage.

original: 'o na bye brag tu bshad pa las nyer bsdogs kyis mtshams sbyor ba'i sems dang / 'chi 'pho ba'i sems su 'gyur ro zhes gang bshad pa de ji ltar nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems la mtshams sbyor ba med pas nyer bsdogs rnams ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bye brag tu bshad pa las nyer bsdogs kyis mtshams sbyor ba'i sems dang / 'chi 'pho ba'i sems su 'gyur ro zhes gang bshad pa de ji ltar nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems la mtshams sbyor ba med pas nyer bsdogs rnams ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The mind of entry to meditative attainment and the mind of death are access concentrations?

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: de rnams la ni mnyam par gzhag pa la nyon mongs pa bkag gi / skye ba la nyon mongs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams la ni mnyam par gzhag pa la nyon mongs pa bkag gi / skye ba la nyon mongs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: because affliction is blocked in equipoise, but not in birth.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir nyer bsdogs kyi sems zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir nyer bsdogs kyi sems zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: To demonstrate that, he says,üîΩThe mind of access concentration is not afflicted.

original: kha cig gsum zhes bya ba ni mtshams sbyor ba'i sems yod pa'i phyir dang / ro myang ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha cig gsum zhes bya ba ni mtshams sbyor ba'i sems yod pa'i phyir dang / ro myang ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Some say three, because the mind of entry to meditative attainment exists and because the concentration of enjoyment exists.

original: don tha dad pa yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la nyer bsdogs rnams ni dngos gzhi la 'jug ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don tha dad pa yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la nyer bsdogs rnams ni dngos gzhi la 'jug ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning is different, because the preparatory stages are the cause for entering the actual basis.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because there is no distinction.

original: ji ltar bsam gtan dang @285a * //
analyzed: ji ltar bsam gtan dang @285a * //
translated: Just as there is no distinction between the first absorption and the second absorption,

original: po na la la na rtog pa dang dpyod pa yod la /
analyzed: po na la la na rtog pa dang dpyod pa yod la /
translated: because in the first absorption there is investigation and analysis,

original: la la na dpyod pa kho na yod pa de ltar gnyis pa la sogs pa dag la ma yin pas der bsam gtan khyad par can ma brjod do //
analyzed: la la na dpyod pa kho na yod pa de ltar gnyis pa la sogs pa dag la ma yin pas der bsam gtan khyad par can ma brjod do //
translated: and in the second absorption there is only analysis, but there is no distinction between the second and the third absorption, therefore the third absorption is not mentioned.

original: de bde min sdug min zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bde min sdug min zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: de na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gsum med pa'i phyir bde ba med la /
analyzed: de na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gsum med pa'i phyir bde ba med la /
translated: Because the three collections of consciousness do not exist there, there is no pleasure.

original: zhi gnas dman pa nyid kyi mngon par 'du bya ba dang bcas pas drang ba yin pa'i phyir dga' ba med do //
analyzed: zhi gnas dman pa nyid kyi mngon par 'du bya ba dang bcas pas drang ba yin pa'i phyir dga' ba med do //
translated: Because it is directed by the lesser serenity, there is no joy.

original: de nyid kyi phyir lam dka' ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lam dka' ba yin te /
translated: For that very reason, the path is difficult,

original: mngon par 'du bya ba dang bcas pas drang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba dang bcas pas drang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is directed by exertion.

original: rtog pa tsam zhig bkag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtog pa tsam zhig bkag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it merely stops conceptualization.

original: rtog med bsam gtan khyad par can //
analyzed: rtog med bsam gtan khyad par can //
translated: The special meditative absorption that is free from conceptualization.

original: zhes smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is stated in the verse: ‚ÄúThe special meditative absorption that is free from conceptualization.‚Äù

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin te zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa las byung ba ni mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin te zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa las byung ba ni mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: The meditative absorption that has that as its object is the meditative absorption of signlessness.

original: yul lnga zhes bya ba ni yul rnams shin tu 'phrog par byed pa nyid yin pa de ltar dbang po rnams ma yin pas yul smos so //
analyzed: yul lnga zhes bya ba ni yul rnams shin tu 'phrog par byed pa nyid yin pa de ltar dbang po rnams ma yin pas yul smos so //
translated: The five objects are said to be the objects that are the most alluring, but the faculties are not like that.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: The three characteristics of conditioned states are origination, continuance, and impermanence.üîΩOthers say that the term sign is a synonym for cause.

original: gzhan dag na re mtshan ma'i sgra ni rgyu'i rnam grangs te 'di las yul chos mtshan ma med cing rgyu med pa yod pas na mtshan ma med pa'o zhes zer ro //üîΩgzhan dag na re dus kyi mtshan ma dang bral ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mtshan ma'i sgra ni rgyu'i rnam grangs te 'di las yul chos mtshan ma med cing rgyu med pa yod pas na mtshan ma med pa'o zhes zer ro //üîΩgzhan dag na re dus kyi mtshan ma dang bral ba'i phyir na /
translated: Others say that it is called signless because it is free from the signs of time.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa mtshan ma med pa yin la de'i yul can gyi ting nge 'dzin ni mtshan ma med pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa mtshan ma med pa yin la de'i yul can gyi ting nge 'dzin ni mtshan ma med pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The object of that concentration is nirvana, and the concentration itself is signless.

original: stong nyid bdag med stong nyid du //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: stong nyid bdag med stong nyid du // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The emptiness of emptiness is the emptiness of the emptiness of the reality realm.üîΩThe emptiness of the reality realm is the emptiness of the ultimate.üîΩThe emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the conditioned.üîΩThe emptiness of the unconditioned is the emptiness of the inconceivable.üîΩThe emptiness of the inconceivable is the emptiness of the nature of nonentities.üîΩThe emptiness of the nature of nonentities is the emptiness of other entities.

original: gang gi phyir ting nge 'dzin bdag med pa dang / stong pa'i rnam pa can yin pa de nyid kyi phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i gnyen po nye ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ting nge 'dzin bdag med pa dang / stong pa'i rnam pa can yin pa de nyid kyi phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i gnyen po nye ba yin te /
translated: The emptiness of other entities is the emptiness of its own entity.üîΩThe emptiness of its own entity is the emptiness of all phenomena.üîΩThe emptiness of all phenomena is the emptiness of nonobservation.üîΩThe emptiness of nonobservation is the emptiness of the nonexistence of things.üîΩThe emptiness of the nonexistence of things is the emptiness of intrinsic nature.üîΩThe emptiness of intrinsic nature is the emptiness of extrinsic nature.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba yang rnam pa gnyis pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar bdag med pa'i rnam pa ni bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po yin la /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba yang rnam pa gnyis pa yin pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar bdag med pa'i rnam pa ni bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po yin la /
translated: The emptiness of extrinsic nature is the emptiness of both intrinsic and extrinsic natures.üîΩThe emptiness of both intrinsic and extrinsic natures is the emptiness of nonentities.üîΩThe emptiness of nonentities is the emptiness of nonobservation.üîΩThe emptiness of nonobservation is the emptiness of the nonexistence of things.üîΩThe emptiness of the nonexistence of things is the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: stong pa'i rnam pa ni bdag gir lta ba'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: stong pa'i rnam pa ni bdag gir lta ba'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: The emptiness of intrinsic nature is the emptiness of extrinsic nature.üîΩThe emptiness of extrinsic nature is the emptiness of both intrinsic and extrinsic natures.üîΩThe emptiness of both intrinsic and extrinsic natures is the emptiness of nonentities.

original: bde ba'i rnam pa lhag ma dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i zhes bya ba ni stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa dag dang / 'gog pa'i rnam pa rnams las gzhan pa bden pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: bde ba'i rnam pa lhag ma dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i zhes bya ba ni stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa dag dang / 'gog pa'i rnam pa rnams las gzhan pa bden pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Concentration associated with the remaining aspects of the truths of cessation and path is the emptiness and wishless aspects.

original: rnam pa bcu @285b pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa ste gnyis dang / kun 'byung dang lam re re la rnam pa bzhi bzhi'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu @285b pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa ste gnyis dang / kun 'byung dang lam re re la rnam pa bzhi bzhi'o //
translated: It has ten aspects, i.e., the aspects of impermanence and of suffering, and four aspects for each of the truths of origin and path.üîΩBecause one is disgusted with impermanence, suffering, and its cause.

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang de'i rgyu dag gis yid byung ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / de'i rgyu kun 'byung ni /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang de'i rgyu dag gis yid byung ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / de'i rgyu kun 'byung ni /
translated: The cause of that is the truth of origin.

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang de'i rgyu dag ste /üîΩde dag gis yid byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang de'i rgyu dag ste /üîΩde dag gis yid byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One is disgusted with impermanence, suffering, and its cause.

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pa dag gis sdug bsngal ba la yid byung la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pa dag gis sdug bsngal ba la yid byung la /
translated: He is disgusted with suffering through the aspects of impermanence and suffering.

original: rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa dag gis kun 'byung ba las yid byung ba'o //üîΩgzings lta bur zhes bya ba ni 'di la gzings dang 'dra ba yod pas na de ni gzings lta bu'o //üîΩde'i dngos po ni gzings lta bu nyid de /üîΩ'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las rgal ba dang 'brel pas na /
analyzed: rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa dag gis kun 'byung ba las yid byung ba'o // gzings lta bur zhes bya ba ni 'di la gzings dang 'dra ba yod pas na de ni gzings lta bu'o // de'i dngos po ni gzings lta bu nyid de / 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las rgal ba dang 'brel pas na /
translated: He is disgusted with the origin of suffering through the aspects of cause, origin, strong production, and condition.

original: lam ni gzings lta bu'o //
analyzed: lam ni gzings lta bu'o //
translated: The path is like a raft.üîΩThe path is like a raft because it is related to crossing over the ocean of cyclic existence.üîΩThe path is like a raft because it is related to crossing over the ocean of cyclic existence.

original: ji ltar 'di la gzings dang 'dra ba yod pa ste ston pa ni dor bar byas pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di la gzings dang 'dra ba yod pa ste ston pa ni dor bar byas pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: How is it like a raft? It is taught that it is because it is to be abandoned.

original: dper na gzings la bstan nas chu bo rgal ba ni de la gnas pa ma yin zhing don byas zin te gzings 'dor ba de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na gzings la bstan nas chu bo rgal ba ni de la gnas pa ma yin zhing don byas zin te gzings 'dor ba de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, having been taught to cross a river by means of a raft, one does not remain in it, but having accomplished one's purpose, one abandons the raft.

original: de dag las 'da' bar mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag las 'da' bar mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because they are directed to the transcendence of those.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang / lam rnams las 'da' bar mngon du phyogs pa ni de dag las 'da' bar mngon du phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang / lam rnams las 'da' bar mngon du phyogs pa ni de dag las 'da' bar mngon du phyogs pa'o //
translated: They are directed to the transcendence of suffering, origination, and the path.

original: de'i dngos po ni de las 'da' bar mngon du phyogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de las 'da' bar mngon du phyogs pa nyid de /
translated: The state of that is the very direction to the transcendence of those.

original: de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that.

original: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gang gi phyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi ting nge 'dzin ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa la mngon par mi dga' zhing de dag las 'da' bar mngon du phyogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi ting nge 'dzin ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa la mngon par mi dga' zhing de dag las 'da' bar mngon du phyogs pa ste /
translated: because the meditative concentration that has the aspects of impermanence, etc. is not delighted with the truths of suffering, etc. and is directed to the transcendence of those,

original: de'i phyir smon pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir smon pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: therefore it is called ‚Äúwishless.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚Äù Because it is similar to nirvana.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa dag gis 'dzin mod kyi /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa dag gis 'dzin mod kyi /
translated: Although it does grasp the truth of suffering through the aspects of emptiness and selflessness,

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa de la yid byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa de la yid byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not a turning away from the truth of suffering.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is similar to nirvana.

original: stong pa dang bdag med pa dag med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i yang mtshan @286a * //üîΩnyid yin te /
analyzed: stong pa dang bdag med pa dag med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i yang mtshan @286a * // nyid yin te /
translated: Emptiness and selflessness are also characteristics of nirvana,

original: chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the general characteristics of all dharmas.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa stong pa dang bdag med par gzung bzhin pa las ni yid byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa stong pa dang bdag med par gzung bzhin pa las ni yid byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But one does not turn away from nirvana when it is apprehended as empty and selfless.

original: de'i phyir smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni de dag gi rnam pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni de dag gi rnam pa can ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the concentration of wishlessness does not have those two as its aspects.

original: dag dang dri ma med ces bya ba la /
analyzed: dag dang dri ma med ces bya ba la /
translated: It is said to be pure and stainless.

original: dag pa pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: dag pa pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Pure means the state of the aids to penetration.

original: dri ma med pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: dri ma med pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs so //
translated: Stainless means the state of the path of seeing.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams ni sa bcu gcig na yod do zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi brgyad na'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams ni sa bcu gcig na yod do zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi brgyad na'o //
translated: They exist in the desire realm, in the unrestricted access concentrations, in special meditative attainment, and in the eight actual bases of the absorptions and formless realm.üîΩSupramundane ones exist wherever the path exists.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams ni gang na lam yong pa na yod do zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang srid pa'i rtse mo ma gtogs pa sa gzhan dgu na'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams ni gang na lam yong pa na yod do zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang srid pa'i rtse mo ma gtogs pa sa gzhan dgu na'o //
translated: They exist on nine levels, excluding the desire realm and the summit of existence.

original: de dag dri med rnam thar sgo gsum mo //
analyzed: de dag dri med rnam thar sgo gsum mo //
translated: They are uncontaminated and the three doors of liberation.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo ni zag pa dang bcas pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrnam par thar pa'i sgo yang yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo ni zag pa dang bcas pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro // rnam par thar pa'i sgo yang yin la /
translated: The doors of liberation are not tenable as contaminated because they are the doors of liberation.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni mi 'thad de /
translated: It is untenable to say that they are doors of liberation and also contaminated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par thar pa'i sgo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par thar pa'i sgo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it says, because they are doors of liberation.

original: 'di dag gi rnam par thar pa 'jug pas na de dag rnam par thar pa'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gi rnam par thar pa 'jug pas na de dag rnam par thar pa'i sgo yin no //
translated: Since they are the doors of entry to these liberations, they are the doors of liberation.

original: sgo mo dang 'dra ba ni sgo ste /
analyzed: sgo mo dang 'dra ba ni sgo ste /
translated: The doors of liberation are like doors,

original: thar pa thob pa'i rgyu la thar pa'i sgo bshad do //
analyzed: thar pa thob pa'i rgyu la thar pa'i sgo bshad do //
translated: because they are the cause for attaining liberation.

original: gang zhig gang gi gtso bo'i sgo mo yin pa de ni de'i sgo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi gtso bo'i sgo mo yin pa de ni de'i sgo zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is the principal door for a certain person is called the door of that person.

original: stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: Emptiness of emptiness is so called because it takes emptiness as its object,

original: de bzhin du gzhan gnyis la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gnyis la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: and the other two should be explained in the same way.

original: mi slob pa'i zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The S≈´tra says that the emptiness of emptiness is for the nonlearner.

original: stong pa nyid kyis ni nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams stong pa nyid du yid la byed la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis ni nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams stong pa nyid du yid la byed la /
translated: The emptiness of emptiness is the attention that the aggregates are empty by means of emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyis ni de'i rjes la skyes pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yin pa'i sgo nas stong pa nyid khyod kyang stong ngo zhes mi slob pa de nyid yid la byed de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyis ni de'i rjes la skyes pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yin pa'i sgo nas stong pa nyid khyod kyang stong ngo zhes mi slob pa de nyid yid la byed de /
translated: The emptiness of emptiness is the attention that emptiness itself is empty, because it is the root of virtue that arises subsequently.

original: ji ltar 'ga' zhig gis shing gi ro mer bcug nas de tshig pa dang / shing de yang 'jug pa de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa bsregs nas stong pa nyid de yang stong pa nyid kyis sun 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'ga' zhig gis shing gi ro mer bcug nas de tshig pa dang / shing de yang 'jug pa de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa bsregs nas stong pa nyid de yang stong pa nyid kyis sun 'byin par byed do //
translated: Just as someone might put a log into a fire and, when it is burned, put the fire itself into the fire, so emptiness burns the afflictions and emptiness itself is refuted by emptiness.

original: de ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam par zhugs pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rjes @286b la bskyed par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam par zhugs pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rjes @286b la bskyed par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: This is the generation of the emptiness that is entered by way of emptiness.

original: bdag med pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'i rjes la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'i rjes la ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the generation of the emptiness that is entered by way of selflessness,

original: de ni de skyo ba dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de skyo ba dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is conducive to disenchantment.

original: ji ltar stong pa mthong ba bzhin du bdag med pa mthong ba ni skyo bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar stong pa mthong ba bzhin du bdag med pa mthong ba ni skyo bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Seeing selflessness is conducive to disenchantment, just as seeing emptiness is.

original: srid pa bdag med par mthong ba dag la yang mngon par dag pa yod de /
analyzed: srid pa bdag med par mthong ba dag la yang mngon par dag pa yod de /
translated: Those who see existence as selfless do not have manifest pride,

original: 'khor ba stong par mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba stong par mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not see cyclic existence as empty.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ting nge 'dzin 'di ni rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa yin yang stong pa nyid ces bya'i //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ting nge 'dzin 'di ni rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa yin yang stong pa nyid ces bya'i //
translated: Therefore, although this concentration has two aspects, it is called emptiness,

original: bdag med pa nyid ces ni mi bya ste /
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid ces ni mi bya ste /
translated: but not the aspect of selflessness.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni ches shin tu rnam par dben pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni ches shin tu rnam par dben pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The aspect of emptiness is the cause of complete separation,

original: dper na gcig pu lam du zhugs pa lam stong pa mthong bas skyo nas myur du 'gro ba de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na gcig pu lam du zhugs pa lam stong pa mthong bas skyo nas myur du 'gro ba de dang 'dra'o //
translated: just as when one traveling alone sees an empty road, he becomes weary and quickly goes away.

original: smon pa med pas kyang nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams mi rtag par yid la byed la de'i rjes la skyes pa'i smon pa med pa smon pa med pa ni mi slob pa de mi rtag par yid la byed do //
analyzed: smon pa med pas kyang nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams mi rtag par yid la byed la de'i rjes la skyes pa'i smon pa med pa smon pa med pa ni mi slob pa de mi rtag par yid la byed do //
translated: Also, by the wishless one attends to the impermanence of the appropriated aggregates. The wishless aspect that arises subsequently attends to the impermanence of the nonlearner.üîΩIt does not attend to them as suffering, nor as cause, etc. The phrase ‚Äúnor as cause, etc.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal bar yang ma yin la rgyu la sogs par yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa dag tu yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar yang ma yin la rgyu la sogs par yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa dag tu yang ma yin te /
translated: refers to the aspects of origin, arising, and condition.

original: zag pa med pa ni de'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni de'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the uncontaminated is not its characteristic.

original: de ni kun 'byung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni kun 'byung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: because it is not the characteristic of origination, etc.

original: de ni sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not related to suffering,

original: de ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.

original: lam gyi rnam pa rnams su yang ma yin te /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa rnams su yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the aspects of the path,

original: de ni de sun 'byin pa'i rnam par zhugs pas lam la sdang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de sun 'byin pa'i rnam par zhugs pas lam la sdang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is hostile to the path, since it is engaged in the aspect of repudiating it.

original: 'di ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pa lam la sdang ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pa lam la sdang ste /
translated: This is the repudiation of the path through the aspect of impermanence.

original: de'i phyir lam dang rigs pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir lam dang rigs pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it does not have the aspects of path, reason, etc.

original: mtshan ma med pa mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa la zhi ba'i rnam par dmigs so //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa la zhi ba'i rnam par dmigs so //
translated: The concentration of wishlessness on the wishless has the aspect of peace in relation to the uncontaminated wishless, which is the cessation not attained through mental attention.

original: ji ltar 'di'i so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di'i so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the cessation not attained through mental attention?

original: mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las langs pa la de'i rjes la zag pa dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma 'da' ba gang dag yin pa ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las langs pa la de'i rjes la zag pa dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma 'da' ba gang dag yin pa ste /
translated: The moments of contaminated meditative attainment that arise after the nonlearner's signless meditative attainment.

original: gal te de dag byung bar ma gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de dag byung bar ma gyur na /
translated: If they do not arise,

original: mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i skad cig ma rnams 'byung bar @287a * //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i skad cig ma rnams 'byung bar @287a * //
translated: the moments of the nonlearner's signless meditative attainment would arise.

original: 'gyur ro // mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i skad cig ma de dag rkyen ma tshang bas so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pas 'gog par 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i skad cig ma de dag rkyen ma tshang bas so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pas 'gog par 'gyur te //
translated: Those moments of the nonlearner's signless meditative attainment would be stopped by the cessation not attained through mental application, because the conditions are incomplete.

original: so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa la zhi ba'i rnam par dmigs so //
analyzed: so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa la zhi ba'i rnam par dmigs so //
translated: One observes the aspect of peace in the cessation not attained through mental application.

original: 'jug pa chad pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir zhi ba'i rnam pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa chad pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir zhi ba'i rnam pa kho na yin no //
translated: It is only the aspect of peace, because it is characterized by the cessation of engagement.

original: zag pa med pa la so sor brtags pas 'gog pa med pa'i phyir so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa kho na la dmigs so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa la so sor brtags pas 'gog pa med pa'i phyir so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa kho na la dmigs so //
translated: One observes only the cessation not attained through mental application, because there is no cessation attained through mental application in the uncontaminated state.

original: yang ci'i phyir zag pa med pa la so sor brtags pas 'gog pa med ce na //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir zag pa med pa la so sor brtags pas 'gog pa med ce na //
translated: Why is there no cessation attained through mental application in the uncontaminated state?

original: mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not incompatible with any of them.

original: gang zhig 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun pa de gtan bral bar bya ba'i phyir bsgrims te /
analyzed: gang zhig 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun pa de gtan bral bar bya ba'i phyir bsgrims te /
translated: That which is incompatible with the ƒÅryas is to be abandoned by the ƒÅryas.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes sngar mdzod kyi gnas dang por bshad zin to //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes sngar mdzod kyi gnas dang por bshad zin to //
translated: That which is free from contaminated phenomena is called analytical cessation.

original: 'gog pa dang gya nom pa dang nges par 'byung ba'i rnam par ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la mi rtag pa pa nyid kyi 'gog pa dang thun mong yin pa nyid kyi phyir 'gog pa'i rnam par ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang gya nom pa dang nges par 'byung ba'i rnam par ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la mi rtag pa pa nyid kyi 'gog pa dang thun mong yin pa nyid kyi phyir 'gog pa'i rnam par ma yin no //
translated: It is not a cessation aspect, because it is shared in common with impermanence.

original: de lta ma yin na ni mi slob pa'i ting nge 'dzin khyad par can de la dmigs par mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni mi slob pa'i ting nge 'dzin khyad par can de la dmigs par mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: If it were not so, it would not focus on that special concentration of the nonlearner,

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po yang mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po yang mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the appropriated aggregates are impermanent.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir gya nom pa'i rnam par ma yin te /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir gya nom pa'i rnam par ma yin te /
translated: It is not a sublime aspect, because it is neutral.üîΩIt is not an escape aspect, because it is not incompatible with the appropriated aggregates.

original: gya nom pa ni dge ba dang dri ma med pa'o zhes bshad na /
analyzed: gya nom pa ni dge ba dang dri ma med pa'o zhes bshad na /
translated: The sublime is virtue and the immaculate.

original: so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa ni lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa ni lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
translated: But nonanalytical cessation is neutral,

original: de'i phyir gya nom pa'i rnam par mi dmigs so //üîΩbral ba ma yin pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'i rnam par ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gya nom pa'i rnam par mi dmigs so // bral ba ma yin pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'i rnam par ma yin te /
translated: therefore the sublime aspect does not apply to it.üîΩIt is not an aspect of renunciation because it is not separation,

original: 'di ltar so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pas 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'phags pa'i lam la sdang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pas 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro // 'phags pa'i lam la sdang ba'i phyir //
translated: because cyclic existence is not renounced through nonanalytical cessation.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is hostile to the noble path.

original: ji ltar sdang zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sdang zhe na /
translated: How is it hostile?

original: stong pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag tu de rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag tu de rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it turns its back on the aspects of emptiness and so on.

original: re zhig ting nge 'dzin gzhan gnyis ni stong pa dang mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dag tu de la dmigs pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam la sdang bar rigs na /
analyzed: re zhig ting nge 'dzin gzhan gnyis ni stong pa dang mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dag tu de la dmigs pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam la sdang bar rigs na /
translated: It is reasonable that the other two concentrations are hostile to the noble path because they focus on the aspects of emptiness and impermanence.

original: gsum pa ni bzhi par 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po la dmigs pa'i phyir ji ltar 'phags pa'i lam la sdang ba nyid du rung zhe na /
analyzed: gsum pa ni bzhi par 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po la dmigs pa'i phyir ji ltar 'phags pa'i lam la sdang ba nyid du rung zhe na /
translated: How can it be that the fourth meditative attainment is hostile to the noble path, since it has unconditioned entities as its object?

original: mi slob pa'i ting nge 'dzin mi 'jug pa'i rgyu'i chos la bsngags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i ting nge 'dzin mi 'jug pa'i rgyu'i chos la bsngags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause for the non-entry into the meditative attainment of the adept.

original: zag pa med pa dag ni de lta ma yin no @287b zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni de ltar 'phags pa'i lam la sdang ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa dag ni de lta ma yin no @287b zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni de ltar 'phags pa'i lam la sdang ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: But this is not so for the uncontaminated meditative attainments, because the uncontaminated meditative attainment is not hostile to the noble path.

original: mi nang zhes bya ba ni mi dag gi nang du'o //
analyzed: mi nang zhes bya ba ni mi dag gi nang du'o //
translated: Among humans means among humans.

original: der yang sgra mi snyan ma gtogs pa'i gling gsum du'o //
analyzed: der yang sgra mi snyan ma gtogs pa'i gling gsum du'o //
translated: And there, in the three continents, with the exception of Uttarakuru.

original: skyes pa dang bud med kyis skyed par byed de /
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med kyis skyed par byed de /
translated: It is generated by men and women.

original: skyes pa 'ga' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: skyes pa 'ga' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only by men,

original: bud med dag kyang tshe'i 'du byed 'jog pa dang gtong ba dag la dbang ba yin no //
analyzed: bud med dag kyang tshe'i 'du byed 'jog pa dang gtong ba dag la dbang ba yin no //
translated: but also by women, because women have power over the life-forming forces.

original: lha dag gi nang du zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mi rnams kyi lus ni shin tu gya nom pa yin yang na ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i rten du gyur pas /
analyzed: lha dag gi nang du zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mi rnams kyi lus ni shin tu gya nom pa yin yang na ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i rten du gyur pas /
translated: In the realms of humans means that although the bodies of humans are very refined, they are the basis of sickness, aging, death, and so on.

original: nang la sogs pa lta bu yin pas de nyid kyi phyir ci nas kyang rnal 'byor pa de bya ba byas pa'i phyir 'du byed zag pa med par 'jug pa la yang mi mthun par 'du shes par 'gyur bar 'du byed 'jug pa la mi mthun pa'i 'duüîΩshes de 'dra ba 'dren pa yin te /
analyzed: nang la sogs pa lta bu yin pas de nyid kyi phyir ci nas kyang rnal 'byor pa de bya ba byas pa'i phyir 'du byed zag pa med par 'jug pa la yang mi mthun par 'du shes par 'gyur bar 'du byed 'jug pa la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes de 'dra ba 'dren pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, in order for the yogi to engage in uncontaminated formations in order to complete his task, the Buddha leads him to generate the perception of aversion toward engaging in formations.

original: de'i phyir mi dag gi nang kho nar skyed kyi lha dag gi nang du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi dag gi nang kho nar skyed kyi lha dag gi nang du ni ma yin te /

analyzed: lha rnams ni phal cher dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa so sor myong ba nyid kyis lus kha na ma tho ba med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because gods are mostly free of physical faults due to the ripening of their virtuous karma.

original: mi g-yo la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi g-yo la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the unshakable means

original: gang gi phyir slob pa dang / dus kyi rnam par grol ba rnams bya ba lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir lam la sdang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir slob pa dang / dus kyi rnam par grol ba rnams bya ba lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir lam la sdang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because learners and those liberated according to circumstances do not detest the path because they have remaining tasks to perform.üîΩBut not for other arhats,

analyzed: dgra bcom pa gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dus kyi rnam par grol ba la ste /

analyzed: de ni 'phags pa'i lam rjes su bsrung ba la brtson pa byas pa nyid yin pas de sun 'byin par mi nus so //

original: nyer bsdogs bdun ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: nyer bsdogs bdun ni ma gtogs so //

original: zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i nyer bsdogs dag ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i nyer bsdogs dag ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: That is, the access concentrations to the second absorption and so on are excluded.

original: de dag ni zhi ba dang rags pa la sogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pas spyod yul 'og ma dang gong ma la nges pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam sun 'byin no //
analyzed: de dag ni zhi ba dang rags pa la sogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pas spyod yul 'og ma dang gong ma la nges pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam sun 'byin no //
translated: Because they destroy the noble path, since they focus on the lower and higher realms through engaging in the aspects of peace, coarseness and so on.

original: yang ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la rgyas par 'byung ba ni ting nge 'dzin la sgom pa kun du bsten goms par byas len mang du byas na /
analyzed: yang ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la rgyas par 'byung ba ni ting nge 'dzin la sgom pa kun du bsten goms par byas len mang du byas na /
translated: If one relies on, cultivates, and repeats meditation on concentration,üîΩone will attain the state of abiding in this very life.

original: mthong ba'i chos la gnas par 'gyur ba yang yod ces bya ba dang / de bzhin du lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / shes rab rab tu rnam par dbye ba dang / zag pa zad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la gnas par 'gyur ba yang yod ces bya ba dang / de bzhin du lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / shes rab rab tu rnam par dbye ba dang / zag pa zad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Similarly, one will attain the knowledge of the supernormal power of the divine ear, the knowledge of the discrimination of wisdom, and the knowledge of the destruction of the defilements.üîΩSince this is the first, there are others,

original: de dang po yin pa'i phyir gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: de dang po yin pa'i phyir gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa la sogs pa dag go //

analyzed: @288a * // 'di ni tshe phyi ma la bde bar gnas par 'gyur ba yang yin te /

analyzed: 'di skad du dge slong gnas brtan gang zhig dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang / tshangs ris pa gang dag der skyes pa de gnyis la khyad par ram / bsam pa 'am /
translated: They say, Which elder monk experiences the joy and pleasure arisen from solitude?üîΩAnd which one is born among the Brahmakayika gods?üîΩüîΩ

analyzed: tha dad du bya ba 'ga' yang med do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúThere is no difference at all in the thought or in the distinction between the two,üîΩbetween the elder bhik·π£u who experiences the joy and pleasure born of seclusion and the BrahmakƒÅyika gods who are born there.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa kho nar ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa kho nar ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
translated: Why is it explained as abiding in comfort in this life alone?

analyzed: de'i phyir tshe phyi ma la bde bar gnas par 'gyur ba ni nges pa med de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúAbiding in comfort in the next life is not certain.‚Äù

analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa thams cad kyi mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa yin gyi /

analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe phyi ma la bde bar gnas pa ni nges pa med do //
translated: But it is not certain that all abide in comfort in the next life.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: yongs su nyams pa dang / gong du skye ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa rnams la de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no such thing as falling away, being reborn in a higher state, or attaining nirvana in the present life.

analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa kho na bshad kyi /

analyzed: tshe phyi ma la bde bar gnas pa ni ma yin no //

original: gzhan dag na re mthong ba'i chos la zhen pa rnams 'dod pa'i bde ba la 'dun pa bzlog nas bsam gtan gyi bde ba la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mthong ba'i chos la zhen pa rnams 'dod pa'i bde ba la 'dun pa bzlog nas bsam gtan gyi bde ba la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Others say: The Buddha explained only abiding in bliss in the present life in order to turn those who are attached to the present life away from longing for the bliss of the desire realm and to connect them to the bliss of the absorptions.

original: tshe phyi ma'i bde ba mthong ba'i chos la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma'i bde ba mthong ba'i chos la rag las pa'i phyir ro //

original: de skad du yang 'dir sngar snyoms par zhugs pa'i phyis der skye'o zhes gsungs so zer ro //
analyzed: de skad du yang 'dir sngar snyoms par zhugs pa'i phyis der skye'o zhes gsungs so zer ro //

analyzed: yang bsam gtan thams cad mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa nyid yin bzhin du yang mdo las dang po kho nar bshad ce na /

original: rnal 'byor pa ni 'dod pa'i khams nyes pa mang ba las 'das pa'i phyir de'i bde bas blo lhag par yongs su tshim pa yin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni 'dod pa'i khams nyes pa mang ba las 'das pa'i phyir de'i bde bas blo lhag par yongs su tshim pa yin te /
translated: Yogis are satisfied with the bliss of the first meditative stabilization because they transcend the desire realm, which has many faults.

original: 'brog tu yongs su ngal zhing skom pa chu rnyog pa can gyis tshim pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'brog tu yongs su ngal zhing skom pa chu rnyog pa can gyis tshim pa bzhin no //

original: 'phags pa'i lam thams cad kyi bde ba dmigs pa'i yang phyir te ;
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam thams cad kyi bde ba dmigs pa'i yang phyir te ;
translated: Also, because the bliss of all ƒÅrya paths is observed.

original: 'dir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa thams cad dang / yongs su shes pa dgu dang / 'bras bu'i lam dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bus bsdus pa dang / khams gsum gyi gnyen po rnams kyang yod pas de nyid mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bshad do //üîΩmig gi mngon shes mthong 'gyur 'dod //

translated: Here, all the factors conducive to enlightenment, the nine forms of complete knowledge, the path of the result subsumed by the result of the way of virtuous endeavor, and the antidotes to the three realms exist, and therefore it is explained that one abides in bliss in this life.

original: ces bya ba la /

original: 'bras bu la rgyu btags pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu la rgyu btags pa yin te /

analyzed: lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa ni ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa ma yin gyi /

analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu yin no //

original: shes par 'gyur ba dang / mthong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes par 'gyur ba dang / mthong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ste /

analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa'o zhes de lta bu la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dga' ba ni mi dga' ba spong bar 'gyur / btang snyoms ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang gnod sems spong @289a * //
translated: and do it many times, disinterest is abandoned.üîΩIf you rely on equanimity,üîΩcultivate it,
