translated: Sexual desire arises through color, shape, service, and touch.

original: mi sdug pa yang de sun 'byin pa'i rnam par zhugs pas 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kyi gnyen por rigs la /üîΩbtang snyoms ni pha dang ma dang bu la sogs pa mi rtog pa'i phyir dang / sems can tsam du 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi sdug pa yang de sun 'byin pa'i rnam par zhugs pas 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kyi gnyen por rigs la / btang snyoms ni pha dang ma dang bu la sogs pa mi rtog pa'i phyir dang / sems can tsam du 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: Aversion is the antidote to sexual desire, since it is the opposite of the latter.

original: de'i 'dod chags kyi gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'dod chags kyi gnyen po yin no //
translated: Equanimity is the antidote to desire, because it does not conceive of mother, father, son, etc., and because it holds sentient beings as equal.

original: snying rje yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snying rje yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Compassion is also like that.

original: byams pa ltar zhe sdang med pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: byams pa ltar zhe sdang med pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Like love, it is by nature non-hatred.

original: gna' rabs dag na re dga' ba yid bde ba'i rang bzhin yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gna' rabs dag na re dga' ba yid bde ba'i rang bzhin yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The ancients say that it is by nature joy and mental satisfaction.

original: gzhan dag na re dga' ba ni dga' ba dang lhan cig spyod pa'i rab tu dga' ba 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dga' ba ni dga' ba dang lhan cig spyod pa'i rab tu dga' ba 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that joy is the joy that accompanies love, and is included in the aggregate of formative predispositions.

original: btang snyoms ma chags zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: btang snyoms ma chags zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: Equanimity is non-attachment.

original: ma chags pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir gnod sems kyi gnyen po nyid du mi rung ngo snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ma chags pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir gnod sems kyi gnyen po nyid du mi rung ngo snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that it is not suitable as the antidote to malice because it has the nature of nonattachment,

original: de ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then he says,

original: gnod sems ni chags pas drangs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod sems ni chags pas drangs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because malice is drawn out by attachment.

original: chags pa'i sgo nas byung ba'i gnod sems kyi gnyen po btang snyoms yin pas 'gal pa med do //
analyzed: chags pa'i sgo nas byung ba'i gnod sems kyi gnyen po btang snyoms yin pas 'gal pa med do //
translated: Since equanimity is the antidote to malice that arises from attachment, there is no contradiction.

original: byams pa dang btang snyoms dag gnod sems kyi gnyen po nyid du mtshungs kyang khyad par 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: byams pa dang btang snyoms dag gnod sems kyi gnyen po nyid du mtshungs kyang khyad par 'di nyid yin te /
translated: Although both loving kindness and equanimity are the same in being the antidote to malice, there is this difference.

original: byams pa ni zhe sdang med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gnod sems thams cad kyi gnyen po yin la /
analyzed: byams pa ni zhe sdang med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gnod sems thams cad kyi gnyen po yin la /
translated: Loving kindness is the antidote to all malice because it has the nature of nonhatred.

original: btang snyoms ni ma chags pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mdza' bas skyed pa'i sdang ba'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni ma chags pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mdza' bas skyed pa'i sdang ba'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: Equanimity is the antidote to malice that arises from attachment because it has the nature of nonattachment.

original: 'di ni gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin na rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ni gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin na rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is suitable for it to have the nature of both.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the counter-agents to attachment and hostility.

original: 'dir bar mar gnas pa'i ma chags pa dang @289b zhe sdang med pa'i rang bzhin la btang snyoms kyi sgra brjod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir bar mar gnas pa'i ma chags pa dang @289b zhe sdang med pa'i rang bzhin la btang snyoms kyi sgra brjod kyi /
translated: Here, equanimity is the term that is applied to the nature of non-attachment and non-hatred that is present in the middle.

original: chos gcig chos du ma'i rang bzhin yin pa ni med do //
analyzed: chos gcig chos du ma'i rang bzhin yin pa ni med do //
translated: But it is not the case that a single dharma has a multiple nature.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: rjes su chags par mi byed la /
analyzed: rjes su chags par mi byed la /
translated: he does not arouse attachment

original: khong khro bar mi byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: khong khro bar mi byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: and he does not arouse hostility.

original: gzhan dag na re byams pa ni bsam pa thag pa nas 'byung po thams cad la bdag dang 'dra bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re byams pa ni bsam pa thag pa nas 'byung po thams cad la bdag dang 'dra bar gnas pa'o //
translated: Others say: love is the state of being like oneself towards all beings, from the very depth of one's heart;

original: snying rje ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal la mngon par mi dga' ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal la mngon par mi dga' ba'o //
translated: compassion is the state of not delighting in the suffering of others;

original: dga' ba ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa dag gis dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa dag gis dga' ba'o //
translated: sympathetic joy is the state of delighting in the good fortune of others;

original: btang snyoms ni phan pa dang gnod pa dag la de'i rgyu mtshan dag la mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni phan pa dang gnod pa dag la de'i rgyu mtshan dag la mi gtong ba'o //
translated: equanimity is the state of not abandoning the signs of benefit and harm.

original: bar mar gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phan pa dang gnod pa btang snyoms su 'dor ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: bar mar gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phan pa dang gnod pa btang snyoms su 'dor ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: Abiding in the middle means that one is indifferent to benefit and harm.

original: de dang mi ldan pa rnams la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de dang mi ldan pa rnams la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Those who do not possess that, etc.

original: de rnams la bde ba de yod pas na de dang ldan pa'o //üîΩde dang ldan pa ma yin pa ni de dang mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams la bde ba de yod pas na de dang ldan pa'o // de dang ldan pa ma yin pa ni de dang mi ldan pa ste /
translated: They possess that pleasure, thus they possess that.üîΩThose who do not possess that are those who do not possess that.

original: mi ldan pa de rnams la'o //
analyzed: mi ldan pa de rnams la'o //
translated: Those who do not possess that are those who do not possess that.

original: gyur cig snyam du sems pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams bde bar shog shig snyam pa ste /
analyzed: gyur cig snyam du sems pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams bde bar shog shig snyam pa ste /
translated: Because of the thought, ‚ÄúMay they be happy,‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal las grol bar gyur cig snyam du bsam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las grol bar gyur cig snyam du bsam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the thought, ‚ÄúMay they be liberated from suffering.‚Äù

original: yang na bsam pa phyin ci ma log pa'i phyin ci log nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na bsam pa phyin ci ma log pa'i phyin ci log nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, the thought is not erroneous, because it is not erroneous.

original: de la bsam pa ni zhe sdang med pa'i bsam pa dge ba'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: de la bsam pa ni zhe sdang med pa'i bsam pa dge ba'i chos rnams te /
translated: In this regard, the thought is the thought of non-hatred, the wholesome dharmas,

original: sems can rnams bde bar gyur cig snyam pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams bde bar gyur cig snyam pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
translated: the mind and mental factors along with their retinue, which have the thought, ‚ÄúMay sentient beings be happy.‚Äù

original: bsam pa phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam pa phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the intention is not erroneous,

original: phyin ci log nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it is not erroneous.

original: yang ji ltar bsam pa phyin ci ma log pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar bsam pa phyin ci ma log pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how is the intention not erroneous?

original: mos par 'du shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mos par 'du shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the perception of conviction.‚Äù

original: mos pa'i 'du shes ni mos par 'du shes pa ste //
analyzed: mos pa'i 'du shes ni mos par 'du shes pa ste //
translated: The perception of conviction is the perception of conviction.

original: gang gi phyir bde'o snyam pa'i mos pa de de kho na ltar 'du shes kyi gzhan du ma yin pa de'i phyir phyin ci log nyid kyi nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bde'o snyam pa'i mos pa de de kho na ltar 'du shes kyi gzhan du ma yin pa de'i phyir phyin ci log nyid kyi nyes pa med do //
translated: Because the conviction that thinks, ‚ÄúThis is happiness,‚Äù is just that, and not otherwise, therefore there is no fault of error.üîΩIf you say that it is nonvirtuous,

original: gal te mi dge ba nyid yin no zhe na ni zhes bya ba ni de la 'di snyam du phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir dge ba ma yin no snyam na ni'o //
analyzed: gal te mi dge ba nyid yin no zhe na ni zhes bya ba ni de la 'di snyam du phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir dge ba ma yin no snyam na ni'o //
translated: if you think in this way, ‚ÄúIt is not virtuous because it is erroneous,‚Äù

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: it is not so.

original: gang gi phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because it is a root of virtue.

original: ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it a root of virtue?

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba nyid la rgyur gnod sems la sogs pa'i gnyen po yin pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba nyid la rgyur gnod sems la sogs pa'i gnyen po yin pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root of virtue itself is the cause, because it is the antidote to malice and so on.

original: 'di ltar sems can rnams bde bar gyur cig snyam du dus gzhan du gnod sems kun du mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can rnams bde bar gyur cig snyam du dus gzhan du gnod sems kun du mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, when one thinks, ‚ÄúMay sentient beings be happy,‚Äù malice does not occur for a while.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //üîΩgal te de'i dbang gis su yang bde @290a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o // gal te de'i dbang gis su yang bde @290a * //
translated: The same should be said for the others.

original: bar mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: bar mi 'gyur bas /
translated: If one does not become happy through the power of that,

original: de bsgrub pa'i ngal ba don med ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de bsgrub pa'i ngal ba don med ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: then is the exertion to achieve it not pointless?

original: don med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don med pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not pointless,

original: de'i sgo nas gnod sems la sogs pa'i skyon rnam par gnon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas gnod sems la sogs pa'i skyon rnam par gnon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because through that one conquers faults such as malice.

original: de la dmigs pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That which focuses on that is

original: 'dod pa'i sems can la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sems can la dmigs pa ste /
translated: that which focuses on sentient beings of the desire realm.

original: khams gang na dgra po dang mdza' bo dang bar mar gnas pa dang / sems kyi gnod sems dang chags pa dang mi mthun pa yod pa dang / gang dag la phan pa dang gnod pa dang / btang snyoms srid pa de dag kho na de dag gi yul yin pas tshad med pa rnams gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i yul can med do //
analyzed: khams gang na dgra po dang mdza' bo dang bar mar gnas pa dang / sems kyi gnod sems dang chags pa dang mi mthun pa yod pa dang / gang dag la phan pa dang gnod pa dang / btang snyoms srid pa de dag kho na de dag gi yul yin pas tshad med pa rnams gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i yul can med do //
translated: The immeasurables do not have form or formless realms as their object, because they exist in the desire realm and they are antidotes to the three poisons.

original: thugs rje chen po'i yul ni yin no //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po'i yul ni yin no //
translated: They have as their object the great compassion of the Buddha.

original: gal te sems can la dmigs pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te sems can la dmigs pa yin na /
translated: If they focus on sentient beings,

original: 'o na ji ltar phyogs gcig tu mos nas zhes bya ba 'di gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar phyogs gcig tu mos nas zhes bya ba 'di gsungs she na /
translated: why is it said that they are generated with respect to one part?

original: snod kyis snod la gnas pa bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ste /üîΩgnas kyis gnas can bstan zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: snod kyis snod la gnas pa bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ste / gnas kyis gnas can bstan zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: It is said that the Buddha taught that the object of the immeasurables is the same as the object of the vessel, that is, sentient beings.

original: snod dang mtshungs par ro gcig tu byas pa'i sems can de na gnas pa dag la mos pa 'jug par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snod dang mtshungs par ro gcig tu byas pa'i sems can de na gnas pa dag la mos pa 'jug par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of that is that the object of the immeasurables is the same as the object of the vessel, that is, sentient beings.üîΩThe Buddha taught that the object of the immeasurables is the same as the object of the vessel, that is, sentient beings.

original: dga' ba bsam gtan gnyis na yod //
analyzed: dga' ba bsam gtan gnyis na yod //
translated: Joy exists in the first two absorptions.

original: ces bya ba ni gang dag gi ltar na de dag bsgom pa las byung ba yin pa dang / dga' ba yid bde ba'i dbang po yin pa de dag gi ltar na /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gang dag gi ltar na de dag bsgom pa las byung ba yin pa dang / dga' ba yid bde ba'i dbang po yin pa de dag gi ltar na /
translated: This is according to those who believe that they arise from meditation and that joy is the faculty of mental satisfaction.

original: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dag na dga' ba yod kyi /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dag na dga' ba yod kyi /
translated: Joy exists in the first and second absorptions,

original: gong na ni ma yin te yid la bde ba'i dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gong na ni ma yin te yid la bde ba'i dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but not above them, because there is no faculty of mental satisfaction above them.üîΩThe other exists in six levels.

original: gzhan ni drug na zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams na yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan ni drug na zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams na yod pa ma yin la /
translated: It does not exist in the desire realm because it is equipoise.

original: rags pa la sogs pa la nges par dmigs pa'i phyir bsam gtan gzhan gyi nyer bsdogs dag na yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rags pa la sogs pa la nges par dmigs pa'i phyir bsam gtan gzhan gyi nyer bsdogs dag na yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist in the access concentrations of the other absorptions because they definitely focus on grossness and peacefulness.

original: kha cig lnga zhes bya ba ni mi lcogs pa med pa ma gtogs pa bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha cig lnga zhes bya ba ni mi lcogs pa med pa ma gtogs pa bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Some say it exists in five levels,üîΩbecause it exists on the actual basis of the absorptions, excluding unrestricted access concentration.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa dang mnyam par bzhag pa ma yin pa dang dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba smos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa dang mnyam par bzhag pa ma yin pa dang dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba smos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is said to be equipoise and nonequipoise, actual basis and preparation.

original: byams pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig ni mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa yin la /
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig ni mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa yin la /
translated: Some such as love are on the level of meditative equipoise.

original: 'ga' zhig ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa yin zhing /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa yin zhing /
translated: Some are on the level of nonequipoise.

original: kha cig gi ni dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs na yod la /üîΩkha cig ni sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na yod de /
analyzed: kha cig gi ni dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs na yod la / kha cig ni sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na yod de /
translated: Some exist in the state of the actual basis.üîΩSome exist in the state of preparation.

original: nyer bsdogs kyi gnas skabs na yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyer bsdogs kyi gnas skabs na yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that some exist in the state of access concentration.

original: de des mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa dag ni sa dgu pa ste /
analyzed: de des mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa dag ni sa dgu pa ste /
translated: Those on the level of meditative equipoise are on the ninth level,

original: dngos gzhi dang sbyor bas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos gzhi dang sbyor bas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are subsumed by the actual basis and preparation.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa dag ni @290b 'dod par gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa dag ni @290b 'dod par gtogs pa'o //
translated: Those on the level of nonequipoise belong to the desire realm.

original: ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig ce na /
translated: What are they?

original: bsam pa las byung ba'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba dag go //
analyzed: bsam pa las byung ba'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba dag go //
translated: They are derived from preparation because they arise from intention.üîΩIf afflictions are abandoned by the path of abandonment,

original: bsam gtan dngos gzhi'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spong ba'i lam dag gis nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: bsam gtan dngos gzhi'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spong ba'i lam dag gis nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur na /
translated: they exist on the level of the actual basis of absorption.

original: dngos gzhi dag pa pas ni nyon mongs pa dag spong ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos gzhi dag pa pas ni nyon mongs pa dag spong ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the actual basis of absorption does not abandon afflictions.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi la 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi la 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
translated: One who is free from attachment does not enter the actual basis of absorption.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi spong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi spong ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not eliminations.

original: re zhig de ltar gang dag mi lcogs pa med pa ma gtogs pa sa lnga pa dag na yod par smra ba de'i lugs kyis ni de lta'o //
analyzed: re zhig de ltar gang dag mi lcogs pa med pa ma gtogs pa sa lnga pa dag na yod par smra ba de'i lugs kyis ni de lta'o //
translated: That is how it is according to the system of those who say that the immeasurables exist on five levels, excluding unrestricted access concentration.üîΩThose who say that the immeasurables exist on six or ten levels say:

original: gang dag gi ltar na drug gam bcu na yod par smra ba de dag gi lugs kyis mos pa yid la byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang dag gi ltar na drug gam bcu na yod par smra ba de dag gi lugs kyis mos pa yid la byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because they are mental contemplations of aspiration.

original: de kho na yid la byed pas nyon mongs pa spong na /
analyzed: de kho na yid la byed pas nyon mongs pa spong na /
translated: If one abandons afflictions through mental contemplation of thatness,

original: byams pa la sogs pa dag ni mos pa yid la byed pa yin pas de dag gis nyon mongs pa mi spong ngo //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa dag ni mos pa yid la byed pa yin pas de dag gis nyon mongs pa mi spong ngo //
translated: then since love and so on are mental contemplations of aspiration, they do not abandon afflictions.

original: spong ba'i lam ni sems can da ltar byung ba dmigs pa yang ma yin te /üîΩ'o na ci zhe na ;
analyzed: spong ba'i lam ni sems can da ltar byung ba dmigs pa yang ma yin te /üîΩ'o na ci zhe na ;
translated: The path of elimination does not focus on sentient beings of the present becauseüîΩif it did, it would be impossible for the path of elimination to focus on sentient beings of the three times.

original: sa 'og ma'i chos dus gsum pa la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: sa 'og ma'i chos dus gsum pa la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The phenomena of lower levels are objects of the three times.

original: rags pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam pa can yin te /
analyzed: rags pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam pa can yin te /
translated: They have the aspects of grossness, etc. and the aspects of suffering, etc.

original: de'i phyir rgyu de dag gis na de dag gi spang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu de dag gis na de dag gi spang ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they do not abandon those objects by those causes.

original: gal te de dag gis nyon mongs pa mi spong na /
analyzed: gal te de dag gis nyon mongs pa mi spong na /

translated: How do you know that attachment to color does not exist in the second absorption and so on?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because eye consciousness does not exist there.

analyzed: gang zhig yul gang las 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni nges par de 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa las kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba yin la /
translated: One who is free from attachment to an object is definitely free from attachment to the consciousness that apprehends that object.

analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa na mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa med pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since eye consciousness and so on do not exist in the second absorption and so on,

analyzed: de dag ni kha dog gi 'dod chags dang bral ba'o zhes bya bar grub po //

original: gsum pa mtha' na zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: de'i phyir gsum pa ni tha ma kho nar nges par byas la /

analyzed: 'dir gzugs kyi phung po ni rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs so //

original: gzhan dag na re de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de ni ma yin te /

analyzed: gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar pa @292a * //

original: 'og ma la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'og ma la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The liberated paths of the access concentrations to the formless realm are also called liberation, but the uninterrupted paths are not because they focus on lower levels.

analyzed: dang po dag ni kha dog gi 'dod chags la rgyab kyis phyogs par byed do //

original: gsum pa ni mi sdug pa la'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni mi sdug pa la'o //

analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams ni 'jug pa 'og ma dang / dmigs pa thams cad la rgyab kyis phyogs par byed do //

analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba'am zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: 'du shes la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir dang / tshor ba la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dmigs pa thams cad la 'jug pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: re zhig 'jig rten na ni shing la sogs pa me 'bar ba la bud shing zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: re zhig 'jig rten na ni shing la sogs pa me 'bar ba la bud shing zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: In the world, wood and so on that is burning in a fire is called fuel.

original: 'dis ni de ma grub pa nyid du ston te me dang bud shing dag ni gzhan pa nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: 'dis ni de ma grub pa nyid du ston te me dang bud shing dag ni gzhan pa nyid du 'dod de /
translated: This shows that it is not established because fire and fuel are asserted to be different.

original: des de tshig pa dang sreg par byed ces pa ni me des bud shing de tshig par byed sreg par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste thal bar rlog go //
analyzed: des de tshig pa dang sreg par byed ces pa ni me des bud shing de tshig par byed sreg par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste thal bar rlog go //
translated: That fire burns that fuel means that fire burns that fuel and consumes it, that is, it reduces it to ashes.

original: rgyud 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thal bar rlog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyud 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thal bar rlog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúBecause it would cause the continuum to change,‚Äù meaning that it would be annihilated.

original: de gnyi ga yang rdzas brgyad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bud shing dang me de gnyi ga 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dag dang rdzas brgyad yin te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang rdzas brgyad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bud shing dang me de gnyi ga 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dag dang rdzas brgyad yin te /
translated: Both of them are composed of eight substances, because both fuel and fire are composed of the four great elements and the derivative form of form, sound, smell, taste, and tangible objects.

original: grub pa'i mtha' las //üîΩ'dod na dbang po med pa dang // sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' las // 'dod na dbang po med pa dang // sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad //
translated: The treatise on the stages of yoga practice states:üîΩIn the desire realm, partless particles have eight substances,

original: ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: lacking faculties and sound.

original: de ni de dang dus tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni de dang dus tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they are different in time,

original: bud shing snga la me ni 'phyi ba'o //
analyzed: bud shing snga la me ni 'phyi ba'o //
translated: fuel is prior and fire is subsequent.

original: dus tha dad pa dag kyang gzhan pa nyid du mthong ste /
analyzed: dus tha dad pa dag kyang gzhan pa nyid du mthong ste /
translated: Things that are different in time are seen to be different from each other,

original: sa bon dang myu gu dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu dag lta bu'o //
translated: like a seed and a sprout.

original: mi rtag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi rtag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They would be impermanent.

original: skye ba dang ldan pa gzugs la sogs pa mi rtag pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on te @302a * //üîΩshing la sogs pa 'bar ba de nyid la zhes bya ba ni de gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi la'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa gzugs la sogs pa mi rtag pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro // 'on te @302a * // shing la sogs pa 'bar ba de nyid la zhes bya ba ni de gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi la'o //
translated: because one sees that form, etc., which possesses arising, is impermanent.üîΩIf you say that fire and fuelüîΩare the same, then they would have to be different.

original: de gnyis kyang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yin par grub bo zhes bya ba ni me dang bud shing mtshan nyid de lta bu de gnyis kyang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yin par grub ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yin par grub bo zhes bya ba ni me dang bud shing mtshan nyid de lta bu de gnyis kyang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yin par grub ste /
translated: If you say that fire and fuel are the same, then they would have to be different, because the characteristics of both are seen.

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung rnams kyi mtshan nyid gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung rnams kyi mtshan nyid gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristics of earth, water, fire, and wind are different.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa rnams ni gzhan nyid yin par mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa rnams ni gzhan nyid yin par mthong ngo //
translated: The characteristics of form, feeling, etc., which are different, are seen to be different.

original: rgyur byas pa'i don yang brjod dgos so //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i don yang brjod dgos so //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúderivative‚Äù must also be stated.

original: de ni de'i rgyu yang ma yin la zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba gsum gyi mtshan nyid kyi bud shing de ni me de'i rgyur rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de'i rgyu yang ma yin la zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba gsum gyi mtshan nyid kyi bud shing de ni me de'i rgyur rung ba ma yin te /
translated: that fuel which has the characteristic of the three elements is not suitable as the cause of that fire,

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir rva g-yas g-yon bzhin no //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir rva g-yas g-yon bzhin no //
translated: because they are co-originated, like the right and left horns of a cow.

original: de gdags pa'i rgyu yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni me gdags pa'i'o //üîΩrten gyi don dam zhes bya ba ni bud shing rgyur byas nas zhes bya ba bud shing la brten nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de gdags pa'i rgyu yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni me gdags pa'i'o // rten gyi don dam zhes bya ba ni bud shing rgyur byas nas zhes bya ba bud shing la brten nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Nor is it the cause of the designation of that fire,üîΩthe meaning of support,üîΩthe meaning of co-originated,

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i don zhes bya ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i don bud shing dang lhan cig 'byung ba nyid du bzung nas zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩrten nam lhan cig 'byung ba dag yin par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rten du 'gyur ba dang lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i don zhes bya ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i don bud shing dang lhan cig 'byung ba nyid du bzung nas zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩrten nam lhan cig 'byung ba dag yin par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rten du 'gyur ba dang lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the meaning of support and co-originated.

original: gsal bar dam bca' ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gnas ma'i bu rnams kyis so //
analyzed: gsal bar dam bca' ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gnas ma'i bu rnams kyis so //
translated: The VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´yas say: We assert that it is clearly not nonexistent.

original: de med na zhes bya ba ni phung po med na'o //
analyzed: de med na zhes bya ba ni phung po med na'o //
translated: If it does not exist, then the aggregates do not exist.

original: phung po med na gang zag med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phung po med na gang zag med par 'gyur te /
translated: If the aggregates do not exist, then the person does not exist.

original: bud shing med na me med pa bzhin no ;
analyzed: bud shing med na me med pa bzhin no ;
translated: Just as if fuel does not exist, fire does not exist.

original: /'byung ba gzhan gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: /'byung ba gzhan gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it has the nature of the other elements.

original: sa'i khams la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan pa de yang zhes bya ba ni dro ba nyid dang ldan pa 'ba' zhig dro bar ma zad kyi /
analyzed: sa'i khams la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro // gzhan pa de yang zhes bya ba ni dro ba nyid dang ldan pa 'ba' zhig dro bar ma zad kyi /
translated: Because it has the nature of the earth element, etc.üîΩAnd that other thing, too, is established as heat.

original: gzhan me 'bar ba dang 'brel pa'i sa la sogs pa de yang dro bar grub bo //
analyzed: gzhan me 'bar ba dang 'brel pa'i sa la sogs pa de yang dro bar grub bo //
translated: Not only is that which possesses heat established as heat, but also the earth, etc., that is associated with blazing fire is established as heat.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar de bzhin nyid yin na nyes pa med pa ltar 'di yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar de bzhin nyid yin na nyes pa med pa ltar 'di yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Therefore, just as there is no fault if it is suchness, so it is in this case.

original: des na brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs de med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs de med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the position that it is inexpressible is untenable.

original: de lta bas na ji ltar bud shing rgyur byas nas zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na ji ltar bud shing rgyur byas nas zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúhaving taken fire as a cause‚Äù is a summary.

original: brjod @302b par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni gang zag go //
analyzed: brjod @302b par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni gang zag go //
translated: ‚Äú It would not be expressible‚Äù refers to the person.

original: brjod par bya bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa lnga ste zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: brjod par bya bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa lnga ste zhes bya bar ro //
translated: ‚Äú It would not be expressible in five ways‚Äù refers to the five ways.

original: 'o na ji skad du brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji skad du brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Well then, how should it be expressed?

original: de ni 'das pa la sogs pa las lnga pa yang ma yin la lnga pa ma yin pa yang ma yin par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ni 'das pa la sogs pa las lnga pa yang ma yin la lnga pa ma yin pa yang ma yin par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It should be said that it is not to be expressed as a fifth from among the past, etc., nor as not a fifth.

original: gzugs kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /üîΩgzugs kyang mig la sogs pa yod na /
analyzed: gzugs kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni / gzugs kyang mig la sogs pa yod na /
translated: ‚Äú Form, too, is not a fifth from among the eye, etc., nor is it not a fifth.‚ÄùüîΩIf the eye, etc., exist, form is designated as form having taken the eye, etc., as a cause.

original: de dmigs pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa rgyur byas nas gzugs 'dogs so zhes btags pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dmigs pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa rgyur byas nas gzugs 'dogs so zhes btags pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that it is designated in that way.

original: drug car gyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: drug car gyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: ‚Äú All six, too, are not a fifth from among the eye, etc., nor are they not a fifth.‚Äù

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is that?

original: gal te mig gis shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la brten nas gang zag dmigs par byed na ni nye bar mtshon par byed na ste /
analyzed: gal te mig gis shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la brten nas gang zag dmigs par byed na ni nye bar mtshon par byed na ste /
translated: If the person is observed in dependence on forms that are cognized by the eye, then it is a figurative object.

original: de'i nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the appropriated object.

original: gzugs rnams zhes kyang brjod par mi bya /
analyzed: gzugs rnams zhes kyang brjod par mi bya /
translated: It should not be said that it is forms,üîΩnor should it be said that it is not forms.

original: gzugs rnams ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs rnams ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is the characteristic of the person, and because it is not an object of expression.

original: chos kyi bar yin pa dang ma yin par brjod par mi bya ba'i bar yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: chos kyi bar yin pa dang ma yin par brjod par mi bya ba'i bar yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies to the other sense objects up to and including mental objects.

original: de lta na 'o na gal te gang zag dbang po du ma'i gzung bar bya ba 'dod na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na gal te gang zag dbang po du ma'i gzung bar bya ba 'dod na /
translated: If the person is the object of many sense faculties,

original: gzugs la sogs pa ltar gcig tu mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ltar gcig tu mi 'gyur te /
translated: then it is not a single entity, like form and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni dbang po du ma'i gzung bar bya ba nyid yin na du ma nyid du mthong la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni dbang po du ma'i gzung bar bya ba nyid yin na du ma nyid du mthong la /
translated: For form and so on, which are the objects of many sense faculties, are seen to be multiple.

original: yang na tha dad pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na tha dad pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, it would be without difference,üîΩlike the sense faculties.

original: gal te dbang po du mas gzung bar bya ba 'di yin du yang tha mi dad par 'dod na ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams gang zag bzhin du du ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dbang po du mas gzung bar bya ba 'di yin du yang tha mi dad par 'dod na ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams gang zag bzhin du du ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you assert that this is apprehended by many sense faculties, but is not different, then like the person, form and so on would not be multiple.

original: de'i dbang po'i sgo nas dbang po gzhan gyis 'dzin pa'i nus pa ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de'i dbang po'i sgo nas dbang po gzhan gyis 'dzin pa'i nus pa ni mi 'dod de /
translated: We do not assert that form and so on have the ability to be apprehended by one sense faculty through the door of another sense faculty.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag la dbang po du ma nyid rtogs pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag la dbang po du ma nyid rtogs pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be pointless to understand that form and so on have many sense faculties.üîΩMoreover, if the person is not differentiated,

original: gzhan yang / nges shes bya na rnam shes drug / bye brag med pa 'am gang zag la /üîΩbye brag yod pa 'am yul la ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / nges shes bya na rnam shes drug / bye brag med pa 'am gang zag la / bye brag yod pa 'am yul la ni //
translated: then consciousness would be six,üîΩor else it would be asserted that the object

original: bye brag med par 'dod par bya //
analyzed: bye brag med par 'dod par bya //
translated: is not differentiated.

original: skra sogs dbye zhes tha dad na //
analyzed: skra sogs dbye zhes tha dad na //
translated: If hair and so on are differentiated,

original: sems can tha dad nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: sems can tha dad nyid du 'gyur //
translated: then sentient beings would be differentiated.

original: de shes pa 'am yang na ni //
analyzed: de shes pa 'am yang na ni //
translated: If that is understood,

original: skra sogs bye brag med par @303a * //
analyzed: skra sogs bye brag med par @303a * //
translated: then hair and so on would not be differentiated.

original: 'gyur ; / gzhan yang 'o ma la sogs pa rnams dang mtshungs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gyur ; / gzhan yang 'o ma la sogs pa rnams dang mtshungs par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, it would be similar to milk and so on.

original: gal te mig gis shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la brten nas 'o ma 'am chu dmigs par byed na ni 'o ma 'am chu mig gis shes par bya ba yin no zhes brjod par bya la ;
analyzed: gal te mig gis shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la brten nas 'o ma 'am chu dmigs par byed na ni 'o ma 'am chu mig gis shes par bya ba yin no zhes brjod par bya la ;
translated: If milk or water is perceived in dependence on forms that are objects of eye consciousness, then it should be said that milk or water is perceived by eye consciousness.

original: gzugs rnams zhes kyang brjod par mi bya /
analyzed: gzugs rnams zhes kyang brjod par mi bya /
translated: But it should not be said that it is forms,üîΩnor should it be said that it is not forms.

original: gzugs rnams ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi bya'o zhes thams cad brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs rnams ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi bya'o zhes thams cad brjod par bya'o //
translated: This should be said for all.

original: 'o ma dang chu gnyis bzhi nyid thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'o ma dang chu gnyis bzhi nyid thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The consequence of the absurd proposition that milk and water are four is this:

original: gal te gzugs rnams zhes bya ba nas reg bya rnams zhes bya ba'i bar du brjod na ni /
analyzed: gal te gzugs rnams zhes bya ba nas reg bya rnams zhes bya ba'i bar du brjod na ni /
translated: If it is said that milk and water are forms, etc.,

original: 'o ma dang chu bzhi tshan du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o ma dang chu bzhi tshan du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then the absurd consequence would be that milk and water are fourfold.

original: 'o ma dang chu rnam pa bzhi par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'o ma dang chu rnam pa bzhi par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that milk and water would have four aspects.

original: sgra ni glo bur ba yin pas 'dir dbang du ma byas so //
analyzed: sgra ni glo bur ba yin pas 'dir dbang du ma byas so //
translated: Sound is adventitious and therefore is not included here.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa'i spyi kho na la 'o ma 'am chu zhes 'dogs pa de bzhin du phung po rnams kyi spyi kho na la gang zag 'dogs so zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa'i spyi kho na la 'o ma 'am chu zhes 'dogs pa de bzhin du phung po rnams kyi spyi kho na la gang zag 'dogs so zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Therefore, just as the mere collection of form, etc. is designated as milk or water, in the same way, the mere collection of aggregates is designated as a person.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, the opponent says:

original: ji ltar gzugs sogs 'dus pa tsam nyid la //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs sogs 'dus pa tsam nyid la //
translated: Just as the mere collection of form, etc.

original: shing sogs zhes byar 'gro ba la grags shing //
analyzed: shing sogs zhes byar 'gro ba la grags shing //
translated: is known in the world as a tree, etc.,

original: rtsva chu sbrang rtsi sogs la ltung ba ltar //
analyzed: rtsva chu sbrang rtsi sogs la ltung ba ltar //
translated: and just as one falls on grass, water, honey, etc.,

original: gzugs la sogs pa gang zag de dang 'dra //üîΩgzugs rnams gang zag dmigs pa'i rgyu zhig gam //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa gang zag de dang 'dra // gzugs rnams gang zag dmigs pa'i rgyu zhig gam //
translated: so is the person with form, etc.üîΩWhat is the difference between the two statements, ‚ÄúForm is the cause for the perception of a person‚Äù and ‚ÄúWhen form is perceived, a person is perceived‚Äù?

original: zhes bya ba dang gzugs rnams dmigs pa na gang zag dmigs zhes bya ba 'di gnyis la khyad par ci zhig yod ces phyogs snga ma la ni gzugs rnams rgyu nyid kyi dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang gzugs rnams dmigs pa na gang zag dmigs zhes bya ba 'di gnyis la khyad par ci zhig yod ces phyogs snga ma la ni gzugs rnams rgyu nyid kyi dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: The first is from the point of view of cause,

original: gnyis pa ni rgyu nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rgyu nyid ma yin no //
translated: and the second is not from the point of view of cause.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: gzugs rnams rgyur byas na gang zag dmigs so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs rnams rgyur byas na gang zag dmigs so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If you say that form is the cause of the observation of the person,

original: de la gal te gzugs rnams rgyu yin par 'dod la /
analyzed: de la gal te gzugs rnams rgyu yin par 'dod la /
translated: then you must admit that form is the cause of the observation of the person,

original: gang zag de yang phung po de dag las gzhan du brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag de yang phung po de dag las gzhan du brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
translated: but you cannot say that the person is not different from the aggregates.

original: 'o na ni khyed la gzugs kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba 'di lta bur thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni khyed la gzugs kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba 'di lta bur thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If you admit that form is the cause of the observation of the person,üîΩthen it follows, absurdly, that form is the person,

original: ji ltar khyed kyi gzugs gang zag dmigs pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar khyed kyi gzugs gang zag dmigs pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: just as you admit that form is the cause of the observation of form,üîΩbut you cannot say that form is different from itself.

original: de yang de dag las gzhan du brjod par mi bya ba ltar snang ba dang mig dang yid la byed pa dag @303b kyang gzugs dmigs pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de yang de dag las gzhan du brjod par mi bya ba ltar snang ba dang mig dang yid la byed pa dag @303b kyang gzugs dmigs pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: In the same way, light, eye, and attention are the causes of the observation of form,

original: de la yang snang ba la sogs pa de dag las gzhan du brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang snang ba la sogs pa de dag las gzhan du brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: but you cannot say that form is different from them.

analyzed: gang zag 'dogs par 'gyur na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

analyzed: 'di ni gzugs so zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dmigs pa gcig pa nyid yin na gzugs dang gang zag yongs su gcod par mi 'gyur ro // 'on te 'di ni gzugs so //

analyzed: 'di ni gang zag go zhes bya ba de ltar yongs su mi gcod na ni /

analyzed: ji ltar gnyi ga dam 'cha'/

analyzed: gzugs kho na dam 'cha' dgos par 'gyur te /

original: de dmigs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyul zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dmigs pa yod pa'i phyir ro // yul zhes bya ba ni /

original: gang gi rang bzhin shes pas de'i rnam par skyes pa'i sgo nas nges par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gang gi rang bzhin shes pas de'i rnam par skyes pa'i sgo nas nges par bya ba yin na /

analyzed: gang zag tu snang ba'i shes pa ni skye ba yang ma yin no //

analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi bar dag la yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zhe na /

analyzed: gang yang rna bas rnam par shes par bya ba'i sgra rnams la brten nas gang zag dmigs par byed ces smras pa'i tshig de'i don ci zhig yin zhe na /

analyzed: ci re zhig sgra rnams gang zag dmigs pa'i rgyu yin nam /

analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na sgra yang rna ba dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa las gzhan du brjod par mi bya ste /

original: de dag ni de dmigs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de dag ni de dmigs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because these are the causes of the perception of sounds.

original: /'on te sgra rnams dmigs na gang zag dmigs so zhe na ni /
analyzed: /'on te sgra rnams dmigs na gang zag dmigs so zhe na ni /
translated: But if you say that the person is perceived when sounds are perceived,

analyzed: ci dmigs pa de kho nas dmigs sam /
translated: is it perceived by that very perception,

analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis gal te de kho nas so zhe na ni / gang zag sgra las rang bzhin tha mi dad pa 'am / sgra kho na la de 'dogs par 'gyur na /
translated: or by another? If it is by that very perception,üîΩthen the person would not be essentially different from sound,

analyzed: 'di ni sgra'o // 'di na gang @304a * //

analyzed: zag go zhes bya ba 'di yang ji ltar yongs su gcod /

analyzed: 'on te de ltar yongs su mi gcod na ni sgra yang yod do //

analyzed: gang zag kyang yod do zhes bya ba 'di yang ji ltar dam 'cha' ste /

analyzed: de ltar gang zag kyang dmigs pa gzhan gyis dmigs pas gzugs las gzhan par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //

original: 'on te gzugs dang gang zag bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs dang gang zag bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /

analyzed: de'i phyir grub pa'i mtha' gang zag kho na brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di nyams par 'gyur te /

original: 'dus byas kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gal te yang 'di yod la zhes bya ba ni gal te 'di gzugs rnams sam ma yin no zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin no //

analyzed: ji skad du gzugs bdag ma yin bdag kyang gzugs ma yin zhes de skad gsungs pa gang zag ni brjod par bya ba kho na yin gyi /

analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: gal te gzugs rnams la brten nas skye na ni sgra la sogs pa bzhin du gang zag rnam par shes par mi nus te zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: gang zag ni gzugs kyi rnam par shes pas mi dmigs te /

analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i phyir sgra bzhin no // sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'dir dri bzhin no //

analyzed: ro bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa sbyar te /

analyzed: de bzhin du 'di rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pas mi dmigs pa nyid du brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: 'di ni phyogs yin no //

analyzed: de lta mod kyi yid ni dbang po 'di dag gi rten no zhes bya ba ni de la ltos pa rnams rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: gal te yul ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba smos te /

translated: If that is so, then since a sutra declares, ‚ÄúIt is not the experience of the domain of others and the domain itself,‚Äù then, having taken the five sense organs as valid, the object of each sense organ is undeceiving.üîΩ

translated: Therefore, the term buddha refers to the continuum of aggregates, not to a person.üîΩThe S≈´tra on the Application of Mindfulness says, ‚ÄúMonks, I have taught you the burden,üîΩI have taught you the burden,

analyzed: khur len pa dang / khur 'dor ba dang / khur khyer ba yang bstan gyis /

analyzed: nye bar zhi ba dang ; nub pa gang yin pa'o //

analyzed: gang zag yin no zhes bya ba de kho na tsam zhig gsungs par 'gyur gyi /
